title: Digital Designer
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Digital Designer at our Stockholm HQ you will play a pivotal role in the rapid, creative and commercial expansion of our online store acnestudios.com. Digital Design plays an important part of Acne Studios' ambition of being at the forefront of luxury E-Commerce. In this position you will have a key role in the day-to-day enhancement of our online store, ensuring the input from the Creative Director and business stakeholders is implemented within agreed deadlines.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with exceptional attention to detail, a creative problem-solver and a team player with a keen interest in design, fashion and technology. The position will be based at Acne Studios’ headquarters in Stockholm and reports to the Head of Digital Studio.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

* Design innovative and engaging visuals for our digital platforms, including acnestudios.com, social media campaigns, newsletters, collaborations, and more.
* Solve complex visual challenges while upholding the aesthetic integrity of the Acne Studios brand.
* Collaborate with UX designers, art directors, front-end developers, merchandisers, content publishers, and the marketing team.
* Maintain design consistency across all digital channels, ensuring alignment with the brand’s creative direction.
* Stay ahead of emerging trends in digital design, fashion, and technology to keep our digital presence at the cutting edge.


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* A strong eye for design with an understanding of front-end implementation, particularly in an E-commerce context.
* A collaborative mindset with a proactive and innovative approach to problem-solving.
* The ability to remain calm and focused under pressure, managing tight deadlines without compromising on quality.


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* At least five years of experience in digital or web design
* Proficiency in Figma
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* An online portfolio showcasing your previous work


**Please attach a portfolio showcasing relevant work as part of your application.**
 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Product Designer - H&M Divided - Jersey Fashion Essentials & Dresses
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 Are you an experienced Fashion Designer with a passion for creating trend-leading, elevated fashion collections? H&M Divided is looking for a talented and driven Designer to join us in our Jersey Fashion Essentials and Dresses department. You will be responsible for the vision and designs of these categories. You will be part of a high speed, high energy team working with youthful fashion products for H&M Divided’s target customer, from current fashion essentials to elevated must-haves.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a Designer with work experience of woven fashion products, a strong attention to detail, knowledge of jersey materials and an innovative design approach that makes our collections really fashion elevated and stand out! The right person is passionate about fashion and teamwork, driven, creative, curious and is able to translate the latest trends into key fashion products for our customer.
   

  

**What Skills Do You Need...**
* BA/MA degree in Fashion /Textile Design
* 3+ years’ work experience as a Product Designer in commercial fashion design
* High skills in Adobe Creative Suite
* A creative, visionary mindset with deep fashion knowledge of current and future trends
* Commercial understanding of the H&M Divided customer
* Have a passion for creating Best Products
* Strong in collection building & visual communication
* Able to work with large collections, parallel timelines and goals
* You are communicative and thrive working collaboratively in diverse teams
* Adaptable and flexible, used to work at high pace
* Strong self-drive and ability to take own initiative and to lead others
* English fluency (Swedish is not necessary)


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 If you are excited about this opportunity and believe you have the skills and passion to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and portfolio showcasing your best work asap to be considered for this role. Please note - This is a 1 year temporary contract to begin with. We are looking for someone who can start in January/February and be based in our Head office in Stockholm.
   

  

**Your design portfolio** 
**should include:** 
 (max 10mb/uploaded document).
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency.

title: Experienced Product Designer
description:
For over 30 years, Wisentic has helped insurers work smarter through automation and innovation. Today, we’re one of the most trusted insurtech companies in the Nordics, using our SaaS products to simplify complexity, accelerate efficiency, and help insurers achieve their goals faster. Our teams are small, empowered, and focused on delivering real value to our customers - not just shipping features.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re looking for an
 **experienced** 
 Product Designer who’s passionate about solving complex problems for professional users. You’ll be part of a cross-functional product trio, working closely with a Product Manager and Tech Lead to deeply understand customer needs, prototype and test solutions, and guide the product experience from concept to delivery. You will be a part of discovering and delivering solutions that are valuable, usable, feasible, and viable.
   

  

 You’ll own the end-to-end user experience, from discovery and research to high-fidelity design, in a product area that’s central to our strategy and growth.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Lead user research, discovery interviews, and usability testing to uncover real customer problems.
* Translate insights into clear concepts, prototypes, and elegant design solutions.
* Contribute to and evolve our design system to ensure consistency and scalability.
* Partner with engineers to ensure design intent is realized in production.
* Champion user-centered design practices across the company.
* Help shape a culture of continuous learning, experimentation, and outcome-driven work.


 Who we think you are
   

  

* Experienced UX/Product Designer (6+ years) working on B2B SaaS products, ideally complex data or workflow-heavy tools.
* Comfortable balancing user needs, business goals, and technical feasibility.
* Familiar with agile and modern product discovery practices.
* Skilled in research, interaction design, and visual design (you can take a problem from ambiguity to implementation).
* Curious, collaborative, and motivated by making a real impact for users.
* Ideally hold an engineering or technical degree - you understand how products are built and can collaborate deeply with developers.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


 Why join us?
   

  

 We are a mission-driven company where your ideas have real impact. You’ll be part of a small, empowered product team - not a feature factory. Work closely with talented peers who value trust, autonomy, and craftsmanship, all in a hybrid setup at the heart of Stockholm.
   

  

 Excited by what you’ve read? We’d love to hear from you! Send us your portfolio and a short note about a product you’ve helped shape - what was the problem, and how did your work make a difference?

title: CRO internship
description:
**Turn Data into Impact**
 Are you excited by experimentation, user experience, and making data-driven decisions that create real change?
   

  

 At Conversionista!, we’re looking for a CRO Intern who’s eager to explore how insights and design come together to drive measurable business impact. This is your chance to dive deep into experimentation and/or UX - while also getting hands-on experience across different areas of conversion rate optimization.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with some of Nordic’s top CRO experts, take part in real client projects, and help turn data and hypotheses into better digital experiences.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Contribute to the design and execution of A/B tests and experiments
* Support in collecting, structuring, and analyzing data across platforms and channels
* Collaborate with UX designers, analysts, and strategists to create data-driven experiences
* Help prepare reports and insights, turning results into actionable recommendations for clients
* Explore and learn from different expertize within the CRO field - from analytics to UX design to experimentation strategy


**Who We’re Looking For**
 You might be a student in UX design, digital analytics, interaction design, or similar, with a growing curiosity for experimentation and data-driven ways of working. You’re curious about
 *why* 
 users behave the way they do and
 *what happens if we change this button or that flow* 
 .
   

  

 Whether You’re More Analytical Or Creative, What Matters Most Is That You Love To Learn And Want To See Your Ideas Make a Measurable Difference.You’ll Thrive Here If You’re
   

  

* Curious and eager to learn - you like to explore, ask questions and grow thorough new experiences
* Self-driven - you find your way forward and seek information rather than wait for instructions
* Communicative and collaborative - you enjoy working with others and contribute to a positive team dynamic
* Adaptable - you’re comfortable in changing environment and open to trying ne things
* In your final year of studies in a relevant program


****What’s in it for you****
* Training and mentorship from senior CRO experts, supporting your growth throughout the internship
* A chance to explore and gaining knowledge across all areas of CRO and access to our exploratory knowledge clusters
* Hands-on experience with real client projects and meaningful results
* Take part in shaping the future of CRO with AI-driven methods.
* Be part of Eidra, a vibrant collective of companies across design, strategy, technology, and innovation.


**Ready to make data talk?**
 Apply now and send your CV and a few words about why you’d love to join Conversionista! and why you are the right fit for this internship - we’ll review applications on a rolling basis.
 **Practical bits**
* Location: Stockholm or Gothenburg (we’re looking for one intern in each office)
* Start: According to your LIA schedule (we’re flexible!)


**Who We Are**
 Conversionista! is Nordic’s leading CRO company, transforming data into insights and measurable growth. We’re part of Eidra, a collective of creative and data-driven agencies shaping the future of digital experiences. (edited)
   

  

 We are conversion optimizers who help our clients use actual data instead of guesses. Armed with scientific methods, we reveal our customers’ growth potential and help them reach their business goals.
   

  

 We currently have over 60 conversion heroes in our five offices in Stockholm, Amsterdam, Oslo, Gothenburg, and Malmö.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective, we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Head of Product & Strategy
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your role
   

  

 At Product Unit (PU) Fighter EW (Electronic Warfare) we are responsible for a number of products within the fighter domain, throughout their life cycle. We have the wide responsibility to define the product offerings, develop sales, executing on won contracts ranging from product definition/development of new products all the way to supporting our customers in their operations.
   

  

 We are now looking for a committed and driven manager to take overall responsibility for our Product & Strategy team. You will play a key role in driving our strategy and R&D activities, that make a real difference.
   

  

 As manager for our Product & Strategy team you will be responsible for the product strategies within the PU, drive the R&D-projects and secure that our existing and new products fulfils the market needs in the future.
   

  

 In addition, you will be part of the Product & Governance management team, where you contribute to the overall strategy, direction, and development of the department.
   

  

 Your main responsibilities include:
   

  

* Line management responsibility for leading roles within the organization
* Project owner for our R&D projects
* Responsible for product strategies and product plans
* Budget and cost responsibility for projects
* Ensuring that plans, guiding documents, and processes are in place and followed up
* Driving continuous improvements and developing ways of working within the organisation
* Supporting leadership in building a culture based on transparency, engagement, and continuous learning
* Actively contributing to the leadership of the Product & Governance department as part of its management team


 Your profile
   

  

 We are looking for someone with a technical background who thrives in a complex environment where you combine strategic thinking with hands-on leadership. You bring energy, a positive mindset, and the ability to see opportunities where others see obstacles.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you should have:
   

  

* Experience leading strategy work
* Previous leadership experience, including personnel and budget responsibility
* Solid understanding of technology and product development
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 With us, you will have the opportunity to influence and further develop our products and strategies ahead. You will become a key player in an organization that values collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 As the selection will take place continuously, is it important that you submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: Product Designer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to be your trusted financial partner. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today
 **–** 
 bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders
 **–** 
 thanks to all the 450+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
**We are now looking for our next Product Designer.**
 As a Product Designer at Sambla Group, you’ll play a key role in shaping the experience of our products - from first insight to launched solution and beyond.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with Product Managers, Local product leads, developers, and data analysts to understand problems, explore opportunities, and ensure that what we build truly benefits our customers.
   

  

**The position entails a wide range of responsibilities including, but not limited to:**
* Manage the end-to-end design process, from research and concept to final UI and implementation
* Responsible for identifying and understanding user needs and pain points through research and data
* Drive design iterations through testing, prototyping, and measuring impact on product outcomes
* Develop clear, accessible, and visually refined interfaces that align with our design principles
* Collaborate on product strategy and roadmap prioritization
* Work iteratively, testing ideas early, learning fast, and continuously improving based on insights and data
* Contribute to and evolve our design system


 Who You Are
   

  

 You’re curious, analytical, and collaborative. You think about more than just final UI and user flows, you care about outcomes. You enjoy working autonomously, taking initiatives, and balancing speed with quality.
   

  

 You enjoy experimenting, iterating fast, and learning from real user behavior.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who wants to own the full journey.
   

  

 From raw insights to shipped products and helping to shape how design drives value across Sambla Group.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 4+ years of experience in UX/UI or Product Design (or equivalent hands-on experience)
* Strong portfolio demonstrating end-to-end design thinking. From problem framing to final UI
* Good understanding of front-end principles and how design translates into code, enabling smooth collaboration and confident handoffs to development
* Comfortable conducting user research and usability testing
* Skilled in modern design tools (Figma, prototyping tools, etc.)
* Strong understanding and knowledge of accessibility, design systems, and responsive design principles
* Experience collaborating closely with product managers and dev teams in agile teams
* Data-informed mindset - able to connect qualitative insights with quantitative outcomes
* Excellent communication skills in English
* Self-driven and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability


**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees.
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 400 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in all markets.

title: UI/UX Design Manager (Relocation to Dubai)
description:
**Position:** 
 AI-First UI/UX Design Manager
 



**Compensation:** 
 AED 25,000 - AED 35,000 per month + Up to 10% Performance Bonus
 



**Total Annual Package:** 
 Up to AED 480,200 (Tax-Free)
 



**The Reality:** 



* Dubai = 0% personal income tax. Your offer is your take-home. ●
* In most major markets, 30-50% goes to taxes. Here, 100% of what we offer is what you keep.



**Location:** 
 Dubai, UAE (On-site) with relocation assistance and visa support
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We're seeking an innovative AI-First UI/UX Design Manager to join our dynamic team at the forefront of internal innovation.
 



  





 You'll report directly to the CEO and hold ultimate ownership of our e-commerce web design, revolutionizing our design process and customer experience through the integration of artificial intelligence while transforming the design team's creative process through AI-driven workflows.
 



  





**The Career Accelerator** 




 You'll compress 3 years of AI-first design leadership mastery into 1. You'll ship high-fidelity web experiences and conversion experiments in your first year. You'll transform how an entire design team works—implementing AI-powered creative operations that eliminate bottlenecks, cutting design to dev handoff time by 40% while rapidly exploring layouts and variants through Figma AI and Firefly, and mentoring your team through a fundamental technological shift that most design leaders won't navigate for years. This pace energises impatient high-performers. It exhausts clock-watchers. If you get frustrated when you're not learning fast enough, you'll thrive here.
 



  





**What Is In It For You:** 




 This isn't just another design leadership role. This is your chance to become a true industry architect.
 



  





**1. Pioneer the Future of AI-Driven Design** 




 You won't just use AI tools—you'll architect an entirely new design operating system. You'll build prompt libraries, AI-assisted workflows, and quality frameworks that eliminate bottlenecks and cut handoff time by 40%. You'll design for conversational shopping, semantic search, and AI assistants while your peers are still debating whether to adopt Figma AI. This is your sandbox to experiment with bandit allocation, LLM-powered recommendations, and Gen AI content operations at scale. You'll master the balance between AI velocity and human craft that most designers won't understand for years.
 



  





**2. Join the Elite Organization and Partner with the 1%:** 



* 🏆 Top 5 Mattress Brand in US
* 🌍 Great Place to Work Certified
* 💡 Work with Forbes Council Member CEO
* Gain firsthand exposure to strategic decisions and high-velocity execution that drives a global brand



  





**3. Experience a World-Class Lifestyle** 




 Dubai offers a tax-free income that translates to significantly higher take-home pay compared to most global markets. Enjoy a cosmopolitan environment with world-class infrastructure, year-round sunshine, and a thriving international community of 14+ nationalities. This role includes relocation support, premium health coverage, and annual flights home—all while building your career in one of the world's most dynamic business hubs.
 



  





**4. Own the Conversion Engine** 




 You'll have direct P&L impact with clear metrics: add-to-cart conversion lifts, experiment velocity, and design system adoption. You'll present quarterly roadmap reviews directly to the CEO, translating design decisions into business narratives that shape company strategy. This isn't design as decoration—it's design as a revenue driver with full executive visibility and accountability.
 



  





**What You'll Need:** 



* 7–10 years in web design for e-commerce, including 4+ years leading, mentoring, and managing the operations of a design team
* A portfolio that shows shipped PDP/PLP/Checkout improvements tied to clear business metrics
* Expert in Figma (components, variables, Dev Mode); strong visual/motion craft and responsive design sensibility
* Proven experience implementing GenAI tools into a professional design pipeline, with a clear understanding of prompt engineering, quality control, and brand governance
* Familiarity with AI-shaped UX patterns: conversational search, assistant UI, recommendation modules, and their measurement
* Comfort collaborating on experiments (A/B vs multi-armed bandits) with Growth; understands trade-offs between optimization speed and causal certainty
* Working knowledge of WCAG 2.2 and SEO fundamentals for structured content and schema on e-commerce sites



  





**Good-to-Have:** 



* Experience designing chat or guided-selling flows



  





**The Puffy DNA** 




 We're restless, perpetually hungry, and fast-paced, driven by an unwavering belief that we can outperform any competitor — regardless of their size.
 


* **Be the Owner:** 
 We don't hire employees; we welcome owners. You're accountable for results, not activity.
* **Execute with Urgency:** 
 We thrive in high-stakes environments by making thoughtful decisions quickly and acting decisively.
* **Demand Excellence:** 
 We solve the hard problems that others can't, pushing the boundaries of our craft.
* **Be AI-First:** 
 Daily multi-turn AI conversations challenge your assumptions.
* **Go All-In:** 
 When the mission demands it, we rally as one team to cross the finish line.



  





**✨ Your Total Compensation & Benefits** 




  





**💰 Compensation:** 



* Monthly performance bonuses (up to 10%)
* Tax-free income
* Annual return flight allowance to your home country
* Parking allowance (up to AED 7,800 annually)



  





**🏥 Health & Protection:** 



* Premium worldwide health coverage (AED 1Million limit)
* Life insurance & Personal Accident Insurance (24x monthly salary)



  





**🌴 Time Off:** 



* 22 working days annual leave + UAE public holidays



  





**🌍 Relocation Support (International Hires):** 



* UAE work visa sponsorship
* International flights & airport transfers
* 14-day 4-star hotel accommodation



  





**💼 Work Environment:** 



* AI First organization with access to AI-native tool stack
* Premium office environment in Dubai Internet City
* Learning & development opportunities
* International team collaboration (14+ nationalities)



  





**✅ Other Benefits:** 



* End of Service Gratuity per UAE law



  





**Ready to Shape Your Story?** 




 Click "Apply" and take the first step.

title: Principal UX Designer
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We craft brilliant games of mass appeal that bring moments of magic to everyday life. We’re seriously playful; we balance art and science, learn fast, and support each other to deliver outsized impact.
   

  

 Your role within our Kingdom
   

  

 If you love designing complex systems that help internal teams work smarter and ultimately make players happier, this is your playground.
   

  

 As a
 **Principal UX Designer** 
 in the Player Experience Operations (PXO) group, focused on Live Operations, you’ll help shape the UX strategy and the tools that help game teams observe player behavior, decide on actions, and deliver live updates quickly - what we call the ‘Observe-Decide-Act’ loop. You’ll create clarity in ambiguity, evolve shared standards and systems, and partner with product and engineering to deliver faster, smarter Live Ops at scale. Your work will create a more seamless user experience across tools, make systems easier to use, and help teams deliver player value faster.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

 Strategy & Systems
   

  

* Lead the UX strategy for key LiveOps systems (such as our internal operations and experimentation platforms), connecting user needs to the foundational tools that help teams deliver improvements faster.
* Lead the evolution of our Unified Design Standards, our internal design-system foundation, by defining shared components, usage guidelines, and best practices that improve quality and speed.
* Partner closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Data Scientists, and Machine-Learning specialists to run discovery, shape problem spaces and success measures, and land step‑change improvements in high‑value loops.


 Delivery & Craft
   

  

* Design end-to-end systems, from information architecture and interaction design to workflow orchestration that simplify complex internal tools, improve user velocity, and enable confident experimentation.
* Promote an evidence-driven design culture, using research and usage data to guide design decisions


 Leadership & Influence
   

  

* Coach Senior Designers and champion design quality across our LiveOps and Shared Tech teams.
* Create shared clarity: document vision, key decisions, and trade-offs; facilitate alignment across Live Ops and game teams to keep work moving.
* Work closely with frontend and platform engineers to explore feasibility early, ensure usability and accessibility, and deliver high-quality experiences.


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

* Extensive experience in UX with recent senior-level or principal experience leading complex systems or platforms; portfolio shows outcomes (metrics, learning, impact), not just artifacts.
* Mastery in interaction design, information architecture, and systems thinking; experience building or maintaining large-scale design systems, ensuring consistency and quality across teams.
* Strong research integration; understands when and how to use qualitative and quantitative research methods and how to translate insights into product decisions and standards.
* Exceptional communication and facilitation; aligns diverse stakeholders and collaborates effectively in complex, cross-team environments with evolving goals.
* Experience working with complex operational tools or data-driven internal systems
* Nice to have: hands-on experience with frontend technologies (such as React) to prototype in code and work closely with engineers.


**Ways of working**
* Hybrid; primary hub Stockholm with collaboration across distributed teams.
* You’ll collaborate with leaders from Product, Engineering, and Data across our Shared Technology organization and game teams.


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.
