title: ASIC SoC Verification Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About the Opportunity:**
 Join our innovative team to apply your expertise and elevate ASIC verification to the next level at Ericsson. We specialize in top-level verification of cutting-edge ASICs powering complex high-performance systems. Integrated multi-chip modules are replacing monolithic solutions. Our designs include hundreds of processor cores, DSPs, ARM cores, tailored hardware accelerator IPs, and high-speed interfaces such as Ethernet, CPRI, and PCIe.
   

  

 As an ASIC Top-Level Verification Engineer, you will be part of a team tackling some of the industry’s most challenging verification tasks, ensuring that our ASICs meet high standards for performance, functionality, and security.
   

  

 You will contribute to developing software-driven tests run in CI regressions on four platforms: SystemC/TLM simulation, RTL simulation, hardware emulation, and, eventually, on silicon. We are looking for someone to strengthen our team with respect to low power verification. Prior experience is preferred, but other matching experience and a strong desire to learn are welcome.Depending on project needs, you might spend significant time on testcase development not related to low power verification.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Define and document verification strategies for the assigned portions of the ASIC as a verifier. Inputs include ASIC requirements, specifications, and information from interactions with various stakeholders.
* Participate in the specification and development of software-driven tests written in C.
* Debug RTL designs with the aid of EDA simulation tools and SW debuggers.
* Contribute to keeping tests clean in the CI regression running on our four platforms.
* Beyond RTL simulations, you will debug failing test cases on SystemC/TLM simulation, hardware emulation, and silicon mounted on boards in the lab.
* Regardless of role or experience, all team members are encouraged to contribute to our shared goal of developing and strengthening the team by sharing knowledge and supporting one another.


**Skills you bring:**
* Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
* Solid C programming skills targeting ASICs or other embedded software
* Solid RTL debugging skills in SystemVerilog or VHDL designs


 Desired knowledge and experience in Low Power verification
   

  

* Experience with power-aware verification (digital, not mixed signal)
* Create power verification planning and strategy
* Prepare power-aware simulation environments
* Simulate and debug power-aware simulations
* Understanding of power techniques (e.g., CG, PG, MV, DVFS, MEM modes)
* Understanding of power intent formats (e.g., UPF or CPF)
* Experience in power-aware GLS
* Experience using formal methods for power verification


 Desired skills:
   

  

* HW/SW co-debugging using SW debuggers for C-code running in the ASIC, preferably multi-core designs
* XPROP and GLS with timing
* Debugging tests running on HW Emulators and/or Silicon
* Simulating and debugging tests running on SystemC/TLM platforms


 Soft Skills:
   

  

* Open, inclusive mindset embracing diversity in culture, nationality, gender, etc.
* Collaborative approach with a focus on team productivity and mutual growth
* Strong drive for innovation with proactive interest in refining verification methodologies
* Clear communication skills for effective teamwork and coordination across diverse teams


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 768410

title: Senior Specialist, Product Management – Emerging Payment Methods
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Senior Specialist, Product Management – Emerging Payment Methods
   

  

**Overview**
 The Senior Product Specialist will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of consumer core payments in Europe. This role focuses on emerging payment innovations, including Alternative Payment Methods (APMs), Stablecoins, and Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs). The ideal candidate will combine product execution skills with strategic curiosity, helping translate complex market dynamics into actionable product initiatives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to define, build, and optimize next-generation payment solutions that meet evolving consumer needs.
   

  

**Role**
* Key Responsibilities
* Support the development and execution of product strategies for APMs, stablecoins, and CBDCs across European markets
* Collaborate with global and regional product teams to ensure alignment, scalability, and regulatory compliance
* Translate emerging trends and regulatory developments into product requirements and business opportunities
* Partner with internal stakeholders (e.g., Engineering, Compliance, Risk, Sales) and external entities (e.g., fintechs, financial institutions, regulators,) to drive product commercialization
* Monitor performance metrics and customer feedback to inform continuous product improvement


 Job Requirements
   

  

* Consolidate experience in product management, strategy, or fintech roles, ideally within payments or digital assets
* Solid understanding of the European payments landscape, including APMs, blockchain-based assets, and CBDCs
* Familiarity with relevant regulatory frameworks (e.g., PSD2, MiCA, ECB Digital Euro initiatives)
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate ambiguity and complexity
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and agile environments
* Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills
* Fluent in English; additional European languages are a plus
* Willingness to travel across Europe as needed


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: IT Support Technician
description:
**Are you the person people turn to when their tech misbehaves? Do you enjoy solving problems, helping others, and exploring the mysteries of networking, hardware, and software? Whether you’re early in your IT journey or a seasoned support hero, this might be your next quest.**
 We’re looking for a curious, socially skilled, and tech-passionate
 **IT Support Technician** 
 to join our Stockholm HQ. At Paradox, support isn’t just about fixing things, it’s about enabling people to do their best work.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 You’ll be a key player in our internal IT team, providing hands-on and remote support across Windows, macOS, and Linux systems. You’ll help onboard new colleagues, manage hardware/software, keep our IT environment secure and stable and occasionally rescue a meeting by reviving the speaker system from the frozen plains.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Provide daily IT support to employees (hardware, software, services)
* Troubleshoot and resolve incidents both on-site and remotely
* Onboard/offboard users and manage accounts and devices
* Maintain conference rooms and other office IT systems
* Support projects to improve and scale our IT infrastructure


**About You**
 You’re a service-minded techie who communicates well, enjoys teamwork, and thrives in dynamic environments. You’re curious by nature and love learning new things as well as explaining them without sounding like a robot.
   

  

**Must-haves**
* A genuine interest in tech and helping others
* Strong communication skills in English
* Curiosity, accountability, and initiative


**Bonus If You Know**
* Windows Server, Active Directory
* Entra ID, Okta, Google Workspace
* Linux/macOS, networking basics, scripting (Python/Bash/Powershell)
* Ticketing systems (Freshservice, JIRA, etc.)


**About The Team**
 Paradox IT consists of two tightly connected teams -
 **IT Support** 
 and
 **IT Operations** 
 - currently eight people strong. While you’ll officially be part of the IT Support team, your work may span across both sides of IT and connect with many departments throughout the company.
   

  

**Practical Info**
* Location: Stockholm (on-site)
* Scope: Full-time, permanent
* Reports to: Head of IT
* Please note: We do not offer relocation assistance for this position.


**If you’re ready to level up your IT support skills in a place where curiosity is valued, teamwork is second nature, and every tech fix is part of the bigger game - apply now. Let’s shape the fu** 
**ture of IT at Paradox together.**

title: IT-infrastruktur
description:
Till SCB söker vi en erfaren konsult inom IT-infrastruktur med fokus på lagrings- och backupplattformar. Uppdraget innebär arbete i en modern datacentermiljö med höga säkerhetskrav där driftsäkerhet, utveckling och förändringshantering är centrala delar av verksamheten.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning**
 Konsulten kommer att ingå i ett team som ansvarar för myndighetens datacenter och lagringsplattformar. Arbetet omfattar både daglig drift, underhåll och deltagande i projekt där nya behov analyseras, designas och implementeras.
   

  

 De tekniska miljöerna består av produkter från NetApp och Dell, inklusive:
   

  

* NetApp OnTap
* NetApp SnapCenter
* Dell PowerProtect Data Domain
* Dell PowerProtect Data Manager
* Dell PowerProtect Cyber Recovery
* Dell PowerScale
* Dell PowerStore


 Konsulten bidrar med expertis inom dessa områden och samarbetar nära andra infrastrukturspecialister, bland annat inom datacenter VMware.
   

  

**Skallkrav**
* Erfarenhet av drift och underhåll samt projektarbete inom datacenter med fokus på lagring och backup under de senaste tre åren.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i stora och komplexa datacenter med höga säkerhetskrav.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med lagrings- och backupplattformar som omfattar minst följande komponenter:
+ NetApp OnTap
+ NetApp SnapCenter
+ Dell PowerProtect Data Domain
+ Dell PowerProtect Data Manager
+ Dell PowerProtect Cyber Recovery
+ Dell PowerScale
+ Dell PowerStore

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i projekt eller nära team som hanterar datacenter VMware.


**Meriterande**
* Certifieringar inom NetApp, Dell EMC eller VMware.
* Erfarenhet av ITIL-processer eller arbete inom offentlig sektor.
* Erfarenhet av scriptbaserad hantering eller automatisering i driftmiljöer.


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Strukturerad och noggrann med hög ansvarskänsla.
* Samarbetsinriktad och kommunikativ, med god förmåga att arbeta i team.
* Analytisk och lösningsorienterad med förmåga att snabbt sätta sig in i komplexa miljöer.


**Start:** 
 2025-12-15
   

  

**Slut:** 
 2026-12-31 (möjlighet till förlängning upp till 12 månader)
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 75% av heltid (kan ökas till 100% under vissa perioder)
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Örebro, på plats fem dagar per vecka
   

  

**Språk:** 
 Svenska

title: Data Center Operator (DCO)
description:
As we are expanding, we’re now looking for a Data Center Operator (DCO) to join our NOC team in Stockholm.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for someone with a technical background who thrives in a fast-paced 24/7 environment, enjoys solving problems, and takes pride in ensuring operational excellence.
   

  

 As a Data Center Operator, you will be responsible for running, monitoring, and maintaining atnorth’s datacenter operations. You’ll work closely with customers and internal teams to ensure system availability, manage alarms, resolve incidents, and secure safe, efficient, and reliable operations.
   

  

 The position is based on-site in Stockholm, working on a predefined shift schedule, as our Nordic Operations Center operates 24/7/365.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Center Operator at atNorth, you will be responsible for monitoring infrastructure alarms related to power, cooling, temperature, and humidity to ensure stable and safe operations. You will also manage internal IT VLAN networks, including basic IT infrastructure, and create, handle, and prioritize trouble tickets in line with SLA requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you will lead the escalation of high-severity operational incidents, communicate with customers, and work closely with site technicians to diagnose and troubleshoot issues with power and cooling systems. You will also support customers in resolving technical infrastructure queries, participate in commissioning and testing of new infrastructure, and report any malfunctions or irregularities to Site Management while dispatching resources for resolution.
   

  

 Furthermore, you will be expected to deliver clear shift handover and operational status reports, manage both planned and emergency maintenance activities, and ensure compliance with safety, cleanliness, and operational excellence standards. Finally, you will contribute to the continuous improvement of processes and procedures, that enhance our overall operations.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* Knowledge of physical datacenter infrastructure and architecture.
* Familiarity with Change, Incident and Escalation Management processes.
* General knowledge of server, switch, and router hardware.
* Knowledge of power and cooling system design.
* Understanding of IT systems and IP network topology.
* Previous DCO or NOC experience is a plus.


**Qualifications & Skills**
* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent professional experience.
* Experience in IT, Telecommunications, or Facility Management.
* Ability to work in a 24/7 shift rotation.
* Strong problem-solving and multitasking skills under pressure.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Professional proficiency in English (Swedish is an advantage).


 At atNorth, we believe that sustainable success starts with the wellbeing of our people. Our commitment to building an open, transparent, and inclusive culture is not just a priority—it is a core part of how we lead, grow, and deliver excellence.
   

  

 Through regular one-to-one engagements and monthly wellbeing surveys, we listen carefully to our teams, ensuring that every voice is heard and every opportunity for improvement is embraced. We recognize that innovation and collaboration thrive where people feel truly connected, which is why we come together each week to share ideas, strengthen relationships, and nurture a sense of belonging—sometimes over a simple breakfast and good conversation.
   

  

 At atNorth, we are building more than infrastructure. We are building a community where people can do their best work and shape the future together.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Weekly office breakfast on Wednesdays and daily snacks at the office
* Regular team events to stay connected and have fun
* Lunch and recreational benefits
* Health insurance
* Occupational health services
* Newest model of Iphone or Samsung for work phone
* Supportive and friendly colleagues across international teams
* A chance to contribute to something meaningful
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth within the organisation


 Background check is conducted for all our employees.

title: Head of Product & Strategy
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your role
   

  

 At Product Unit (PU) Fighter EW (Electronic Warfare) we are responsible for a number of products within the fighter domain, throughout their life cycle. We have the wide responsibility to define the product offerings, develop sales, executing on won contracts ranging from product definition/development of new products all the way to supporting our customers in their operations.
   

  

 We are now looking for a committed and driven manager to take overall responsibility for our Product & Strategy team. You will play a key role in driving our strategy and R&D activities, that make a real difference.
   

  

 As manager for our Product & Strategy team you will be responsible for the product strategies within the PU, drive the R&D-projects and secure that our existing and new products fulfils the market needs in the future.
   

  

 In addition, you will be part of the Product & Governance management team, where you contribute to the overall strategy, direction, and development of the department.
   

  

 Your main responsibilities include:
   

  

* Line management responsibility for leading roles within the organization
* Project owner for our R&D projects
* Responsible for product strategies and product plans
* Budget and cost responsibility for projects
* Ensuring that plans, guiding documents, and processes are in place and followed up
* Driving continuous improvements and developing ways of working within the organisation
* Supporting leadership in building a culture based on transparency, engagement, and continuous learning
* Actively contributing to the leadership of the Product & Governance department as part of its management team


 Your profile
   

  

 We are looking for someone with a technical background who thrives in a complex environment where you combine strategic thinking with hands-on leadership. You bring energy, a positive mindset, and the ability to see opportunities where others see obstacles.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you should have:
   

  

* Experience leading strategy work
* Previous leadership experience, including personnel and budget responsibility
* Solid understanding of technology and product development
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 With us, you will have the opportunity to influence and further develop our products and strategies ahead. You will become a key player in an organization that values collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 As the selection will take place continuously, is it important that you submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: Digital Designer
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Digital Designer at our Stockholm HQ you will play a pivotal role in the rapid, creative and commercial expansion of our online store acnestudios.com. Digital Design plays an important part of Acne Studios' ambition of being at the forefront of luxury E-Commerce. In this position you will have a key role in the day-to-day enhancement of our online store, ensuring the input from the Creative Director and business stakeholders is implemented within agreed deadlines.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with exceptional attention to detail, a creative problem-solver and a team player with a keen interest in design, fashion and technology. The position will be based at Acne Studios’ headquarters in Stockholm and reports to the Head of Digital Studio.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

* Design innovative and engaging visuals for our digital platforms, including acnestudios.com, social media campaigns, newsletters, collaborations, and more.
* Solve complex visual challenges while upholding the aesthetic integrity of the Acne Studios brand.
* Collaborate with UX designers, art directors, front-end developers, merchandisers, content publishers, and the marketing team.
* Maintain design consistency across all digital channels, ensuring alignment with the brand’s creative direction.
* Stay ahead of emerging trends in digital design, fashion, and technology to keep our digital presence at the cutting edge.


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* A strong eye for design with an understanding of front-end implementation, particularly in an E-commerce context.
* A collaborative mindset with a proactive and innovative approach to problem-solving.
* The ability to remain calm and focused under pressure, managing tight deadlines without compromising on quality.


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* At least five years of experience in digital or web design
* Proficiency in Figma
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* An online portfolio showcasing your previous work


**Please attach a portfolio showcasing relevant work as part of your application.**
 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Communication Manager | SEB Kort, Solna
description:
Are you ready to shape the communication strategy at SEB Kort, a successful and growing company in the card payment industry with a position as the leading European corporate payment provider? We are looking for an experienced, strategically minded Communication Manager to join our team in Solna.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Communication Manager, you will be responsible – together with the Communication Manager in Germany – for developing and implementing the company’s strategic communication initiatives, with specific focus on internal communication. You will report directly to the Head of Corporate Development and work closely with other key functions to ensure a strong and cohesive communications strategy.
   

  

 This role combines both strategic and hands-on responsibilities. You will lead internal communications initiatives and, with your strong writing and communication skills, actively contribute to conveying the company's goals and vision in an engaging and clear way.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Develop and implement the company’s communications strategy, focusing on internal communication
* Write, edit, and adapt internal communication to ensure clarity and engagement among employees
* Support and guide the executive management team in communication matters, strengthening our internal brand
* Coordinate and work closely with our Communication Manager in Germany to ensure consistent, high-quality communication
* Collaborate with other departments to maintain a unified communications strategy that reflects the company's values and goals
* Together with the Communication Manager in Germany, plan, develop and launch a new SEB Kort Group Intranet, securing an active and efficient internal communication platform


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience in strategic communication work, preferably with a focus on internal communication
* Proven ability to write and produce internal communication that engages and inspires
* Fluency in both Swedish and English; German language skills is a plus
* Strong skills in balancing strategic and operational tasks in a dynamic environment
* Experience in an international setting and working closely with executive teams is a plus


**What We Offer**
* A key role in a growing corporate payment solutions company with high ambitions
* The opportunity to influence and contribute meaningfully to our communications strategy
* An international and dynamic work environment with dedicated and knowledgeable colleagues
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


 Do you want to be part of SEB?
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than
 **12th of November 2025** 
 . If you have questions about the position, please contact Peter Hjelm, Hiring Manager, on peter.hjelm@seb.se, or Olga Wohlfahrt, Talent Acquisition Partner, on olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se. But we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Engineering Manager - Frontend CoE
description:
**Job Description**
 As Engineering Manager, you will lead engineers in an engineering area and have formal staff responsibility for several Engineering talents. You are responsible for building a strong engineering culture designing a Community of Practices for your area and enabling and securing strong organizational health by ensuring that you plan for both deliveries as well as competence development. Within your area, you will be responsible for recruiting, staffing, and retaining talents including having a healthy mix of consultants and employees in appropriate tech locations. As Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring that the team can staff initiative in an efficient way according to set goals – with a healthy work/life balance.
   

  

 The EM would play a pivotal role in driving the tech landscape aligning top talent to help our product team to achieve their business objective through exceptional quality and delivery of products.
   

  

**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**
* Acting as the employer's extended arm to follow and implement H&M Group’s vision, goal, strategies, values, policies, and processes, as well as acting as an ambassador, representing the management internally and externally.
* Leading and steering an area with Software Engineers for a set of technology, software, or platform development.
* Supporting your organization’s employee development
* Set objectives and inspire team members based on specific competence needs.
* Performance management and salary reviews
* Stay compliant with laws and policies, and act, when necessary, in regard to e.g., underperformance, work environment, rehab cases, etc.
* Recognize progress towards ambition and goal and required growth.
* Budget responsibility for FTE & FTC budget
* Building a strong organizational health, role & competence development
* Recruitment and retention strategy for talents
* To establish a continuous learning & development activity within your area and contribute to an outside-in vision for competence development.
* Stakeholder management
* Ensuring that your teams have a healthy mix of consultants and employees in the appropriate tech locations.


**YOU HAVE:**
* 10 + years as a technology leader using & implementing modern technology in complex organizations at scale.
* Experience in front-end development.
* 2 + years of experience in managing a team of Software engineers.
* Great stakeholder management skills and collaboration across business units
* Interested in developing people and building an extraordinary engineering culture.
* Sound financial and forecasting skills and experience handling resource allocation budgets.
* Proven experience in building successful communities of practice.
* Cultivate trust and empower others to both responsibilities, dare to fail, learn, and grow.
* Strong interpersonal, collaborative, and communication skills.
* Ability and credibility to lead and guide both in-house and third-party teams.
* Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities


**Functional Knowledge:**
* Strong leadership skills.
* Senior formal manager/staff responsible skills (incl. recruitment, performance development, career planning)
* Workforce planning
* Budgeting and forecasting
* Agentic AI, Gen AI, Successful implementation of AI in automation and engineering efficiency
* Cloud and future proof web application architecture
* Technology development & lifecycles
* Agile and DevOps practices
* Enterprise Architecture concepts
* Cybersecurity and privacy concepts, principles & solutions


**Leadership Behaviors:**
 As a role model for our values and putting them into action, you are expected to demonstrate excellent cognitive, social, and emotional skills and know how to nurture them in others by having the ability to…
   

  

* commit to directional decisions, take ownership of the whole and, collaborate across boundaries.
* communicate in a timely and perfect way.
* strive for speed, reduce complexity, and focus on the outcome.


 … stay curious and be open to new perspectives.
   

  

***Please note:***
 As our culture and teamwork are very important to us, four days (80%) per week of in-office presence in our office are required.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Management Trainee - Utveckling konsultverksamhet
description:
Vi har förmånen att leva i ett av världens finaste länder. Men vi på Atea vill mer. Som specialister inom informationsteknologi tänker vi vara med och forma ett ännu bättre Sverige. Genom att skapa lösningar som nästa generation kan känna sig stolta över är du som medarbetare på Atea med och lägger grunden till ett smartare och mer innovativt Sverige.
   

  

**Din roll i laget**
*"* 
*Som Management Trainee på Atea får man en unik inblick i verksamhetens olika affärsområden och enheter, i en stöttande företagskultur där personlig och professionell utveckling står i fokus. Du får möjlighet att utveckla ditt ledarskap, problemlösningsförmåga och andra färdigheter genom att leda utmanande projekt, delta i utbildningar, nätverka med kunniga kollegor, få coachning från erfarna ledare och delta i samtal på ledningsnivå. Programmet överträffade mina förväntningar genom stort ansvar och förtroende från dag ett, och ännu mer när jag insåg att mina idéer faktiskt implementerades och gjorde skillnad. Tiden som trainee var både utmanande och utvecklande, fylld av lärorika upplevelser och givande erfarenheter, men framför allt otroligt rolig och präglad av många skratt!* 
*"*
 Irma Ekdahl, fd Trainee, idag Intern Projektledare på Atea.
   

  

 Låter det spännande? Då kan du vara en av fyra traineer som får en unik möjlighet att under programmets gång komma in i vår verksamhet och utvecklas med oss. Under traineeperioden kommer du ha personlig kontakt med Ateas VD Linus Wallin, få en mentor med lång ledarerfarenhet och bli en del av alumninätverket för traineer.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Under traineeperiodens 10 månader kommer du att dela din tid mellan Ateas olika enheter och därefter påbörja din resa mot att bli en av våra stjärnor. Som trainee skapar du ett kontaktnät inom Atea och på så sätt marknadsför du dig och dina kunskaper.
   

  

 Under året roterar du på fem moduler, varav två är kopplade till din valda inriktning. Mellan modulerna har du tillsammans med de andra traineerna caseveckor, utbildningar, kontorsbesök samt mentors- och VD-dagar. När traineeperioden lider mot sitt slut beror din nästa roll på din inriktning och dina ambitioner, men även var det finns möjligheter.
   

  

**Om inriktningen**
 Det finns fyra inriktningar på årets traineeprogram; mjukvara & moln, utveckling konsultverksamhet, försäljning & upphandling Region Mitt och försäljning & upphandling Region Syd. Du väljer vilken av inriktningarna du vill söka till genom att ansöka via rätt annons. Efter genomfört traineeår fortsätter du din resa på Atea i en roll inom inriktningen.
   

  

**Verksamhetsutveckling – Consulting Services:**
 Atea har ca 1000 konsulter i Sverige fördelat på våra 36 kontor. Konsulterna hjälper våra kunder med allt från digitalisering, verksamhetsutveckling, säkerhetslösningar, kreativare och effektivare arbetsplatser, till it-infrastruktur och drift. Tillsammans skapar våra konsulter lösningar som gör skillnad – för våra kunder, samhället och framtiden.
   

  

 Consulting Services är en av våra fyra business lines. Den nationella enheten Consulting Services Development ansvarar för att utveckla vårt arbetssätt och öka effektiviteten i våra processer och stödsystem.
   

  

 Som trainee inom denna inriktning får du möjlighet att lära dig om arbetet hos Consulting Services Development och få inblick i hur teamet arbetar både strategiskt och operativt med att utveckla vår konsultverksamhet. Här får du vara med och forma framtidens arbetssätt, förbättra våra systemstöd och stärka samverkan mellan olika delar av organisationen.
   

  

 Vår vision är att bli Sveriges bästa konsultbolag – och med den som riktning bygger vi “The Place To Be” (TP2B) för våra konsulter. Det innebär att vi jobbar för att skapa en arbetsmiljö där man inom konsultverksamheten trivs, vill stanna, utvecklas, påverka och vara med och skapa något större.
   

  

 Efter traineeåret kliver du in i en roll inom Consulting Services Development, där du fortsätter att bidra till utvecklingen av Ateas konsultverksamhet. Läs mer om Ateas konsultverksamhet här.
   

  

**Vad vi söker hos dig**
* Du är nyutexaminerad (minst 180 hp) med max 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet efter examen. Inriktning på utbildningen har mindre betydelse.
* Du har kunskap om och intresse för it.
* Du kan identifiera dig med våra värderingar och en företagskultur som lever dessa värderingar lockar dig.
* Du söker aktivt nya utvecklingsmöjligheter och ser dig själv i en ledarroll om några år. Du är trygg och hanterar nya situationer med nyfikenhet och entusiasm. Att arbeta strukturerat och ambitiöst mot givna eller egna mål ser du som stimulerande och en given del av ditt arbete.
* Du talar och skriver flytande svenska.


**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med it och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara it-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar it-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Detta är en CV-lös ansökningsprocess, vilket innebär att du i det första steget endast svarar på några få urvalsfrågor. Därefter kommer du att få mer information om hur den vidare processen ser ut. Har du frågor om oss eller tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Jennifer Sturedahl, jennifer.sturedahl@atea.se.
 **Sista ansökningsdag är den** 
**6 januari** 
 .
   

  

 Denna rekrytering görs tillsammans med HOME of Recruitment.
   

  

 Som ett kvalitativt led i vårt rekryteringsarbete genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare.
   

  

 Atea vill vara The Place To Be och därför värdesätter vi de kvalitéer som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
   

  

**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Säkerhetstekniker till Securitas Technology – Stockholm
description:
**Securitas Technology – See a different world.**
 På Securitas Technology drivs vi av viljan att skapa trygghet – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken och genom människorna bakom den. Med över 70 års erfarenhet och en ledande position på marknaden är vi idag en av de största aktörerna inom säkerhetsteknik – både i Sverige och globalt
 *.* 
 Vi kombinerar styrkan i ett stort företag med värmen från en familjär kultur där varje individ räknas💜
   

  

**Nu söker vi flera säkerhetstekniker till Stockholm. Vi växer i Stockholm och söker dig som vill vara med och säkerställa vår leverans hos några av våra viktigaste kunder.** 
 Hos oss får du arbeta med högsäkerhetslösningar, den nyaste teknologin och några av de mest spännande kunderna i branschen.
   

  

 Vi tror att du är trygg i din roll som säkerhetstekniker och gärna axlar rollen som ledande tekniker. Du vill vara i framkant och leverera det bästa och senaste till våra kunder. Låter det som en intressant roll för dig? Tveka då inte att söka den här rollen där du blir del av ett högpresterande gäng med gott samarbete.
   

  

**📍** 
**Placeringsort: Stockholm.** 
 Resor inom regionen är en naturlig del av tjänsten.
   

  

**Din roll – mer än teknik!**
 Som
 **säkerhetstekniker inom säkerhetsteknik** 
 är du en viktig del av vårt uppdrag:
 *att skapa trygghet genom innovativa lösningar.* 
 Du ansvarar du för installation och mindre driftsättningar av våra säkerhetssystem, så som passersystem, inbrottslarm, kameraövervakning och integrerade säkerhetssystem. Du arbetar med:
   

  

* Installation, inkoppling, driftsättning, programmering, avprovning och utbildning.
* Tillsammans med projektledare är du med och utvecklar våra kunders lösningar.
* Genomföra överlämning och handhavandeutbildning till våra kunder.
* Agera ledande tekniker där du leder underentreprenörer.


**Vem är du?**
* Du älskar att ta ansvar och motiveras av att leverera den bästa lösningen till kund.
* Du är van att arbeta självständigt och trivs med att planera dina egna dagar.
* Du är prestigelös och skicklig på att bygga relationer, både med kollegor och kunder.
* Du trivs med att ha mycket på gång och ser komplexa problem som spännande utmaningar och har en naturlig förmåga att hitta lösningar.


**Grundkompetenser**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en självgående roll inom säkerhetsteknik eller liknande.
* Du kan grunderna kring el/svagström & har intresse för teknik och IT.
* Utbildning på gymnasienivå/YH, gärna inom säkerhet, el, teknik eller IT.
* Talar svenska och engelska samt har B-körkort.


**Meriterande:** 
 Om du är erfaren säkerhetstekniker idag och vill ta nästa steg i en mer ledande roll.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder Dig**
* Utvecklas inom installation och teknik hos Nordens marknadsledare inom innovativ säkerhetsteknik💻
* Lära dig av seniora tekniker och arbeta med några av dom mest spännande kunderna i branschen🚀
* Bli en del av ett företag där alla delar passionen att leverera den bästa lösningen till kunden.
* En prestigelös kultur med fokus på samarbete – det finns alltid någon man kan ringa!📞
* Här får du vara med och göra skillnad och bidra till ett säkrare samhälle✨


**Securitas – See a different world** 
 🌍
   

  

 Vi ser möjligheter där andra ser hinder. Och vi arbetar varje dag för att göra världen säkrare – tillsammans.
   

  

**Ansök redan idag!** 
 Vi arbetar med löpande urval så skicka in din ansökan direkt. Då vi närmar oss semestertider kommer intervjuer att ske i augusti/september.
   

  

**📩 Kontakta Oss Gärna**
*Rekryteringsspecialist:* 
 Sara Andersson
   

  

 📧 sara.andersson@securitas.com
   

  

*Facklig kontakt:* 
 Riksklubben (SEF)
   

  

 📧riksklubbenSEF@securitas.com
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på Securitas Technology här💜Ansök idag – och
 *See a different world!*
 🔒
 **Tjänsten kräver svenskt medborgarskap samt godkänd bakgrunds- och säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).**

title: Automation Engineer
description:
**Assignment Overview:** 




 We are seeking an experienced
 **Automation Engineer** 
 to lead the reprogramming and further development of a
 **pre-assembly piston production line** 
 . This is a
 **hands-on, onsite role** 
 focused on creating new code for an operational production system.
 



 You will be responsible for
 **designing, implementing, and optimizing automation solutions** 
 using
 **Siemens TIA Portal (v17+)** 
 , ensuring high performance, safety, and reliability. The work involves system architecture, PLC and HMI programming, and integration with existing industrial and IT systems.
 


**Key Responsibilities** 
* Design, develop, and implement
 **control logic** 
 in
 **Siemens TIA Portal** 
 using
 **LAD, GRAPH, and SCL** 
 .
* Architect and program the
 **PPAP software system** 
 , defining robust
 **signal models** 
 and ensuring seamless system communication.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to
 **reprogram and enhance existing production line automation** 
 .
* Integrate and troubleshoot
 **OPC UA, Profinet** 
 , and
 **Cognex vision systems** 
 .
* Ensure safety and quality compliance across all automation solutions.
* Contribute to
 **simulation and virtual commissioning** 
 activities.
* Diagnose and resolve issues related to
 **industrial networks and communication protocols** 
 .
* Develop
 **modular, reusable, and scalable code architectures** 
 for large, complex systems.


**Qualifications** 
* **7+ years** 
 of hands-on experience delivering
 **Siemens TIA Portal automation projects** 
 .
* **3+ years** 
 of experience developing
 **machine logic from scratch** 
 in a production environment.
* Proven expertise in
 **modular and reusable code development** 
 within large-scale automation systems.
* Previous experience leading
 **reprogramming and upgrade projects** 
 for existing production lines.
* Knowledge of
 **traceability systems, multi-variant logic** 
 , and
 **MES integration** 
 is highly valued.
* **Bachelor’s degree** 
 in
 **Industrial Automation** 
 or a related field.
* Strong
 **English communication skills** 
 (Swedish is a plus).
* A
 **collaborative and flexible** 
 mindset with the ability to engage effectively with technical teams and business stakeholders.
* Confident in taking technical ownership and driving results in a
 **dynamic, hands-on environment** 
 .

title: Hub Manager / Team Manager
description:
