title: Customer Success Assistant
description:
**Working at Mercell**
 At Mercell, we're on a mission to revolutionize public procurement, making it accessible and effortless for everyone involved. Imagine a world where public buyers and visionary suppliers come together seamlessly to make a great deal easier and shape the future. That's what we're all about.
   

  

 With a dynamic culture built on continuous growth, trust, and collaboration, Mercell offers an environment where your talents can thrive. You will be part of an international environment with ambitious and dedicated colleagues who are passionate about what they do and supported to be themselves.
   

  

 Together, let's shape the future and create real value for society, one innovative solution at a time.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 As a Customer Success Assistant at Mercell, you will be part of the Customer Success Operations team. Customer Success is a team of 40 professionals delivering value to all customers by engaging in a consistent, sustainable, scalable way across all markets and solutions so that customers realize value in their investment with Mercell. This role will work with supporting Customer Success Managers and with customers in the public sector.
   

  

 We see the following qualities as important to thrive and evolve in this role:
   

  

* Being proactive.
* Team collaborator with high energy.
* Comfortable with difficult conversation.
* Results driven and adaptable to changes.


**Core Responsibilities**
* Respond to and handle customer inquiries regarding billing, indexations and account information.
* Distribute and follow up on internal cases for quick resolution of customer problems.
* Maintain customer data in our CRM system and Case system and use tools to improve workflows.
* Build good customer relationships and work proactively to solve their needs.
* Support the Customer Success team in various projects and tasks.


**Required Qualifications**
* Experience in customer service or a similar customer-facing roles
* Good computer and system skills
* Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously with precision
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in Swedish and English


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Knowledge of Jira
* Customer management skills
* Experience working in CRM systems and case management systems
* Basic financial understanding; ability to manage and resolve billing issues effectively


**Start date:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

**Duration:** 
 6 months (full time), with a possibility to extend to 12 months
   

  

**Workplace type:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Application Deadline: 24 November, 2025.** 
 However, do not wait to submit your application - we will read applications and talk to potential candidates as we receive them
   

  

**What We Offer**
 As a fast growing technology company, we are committed to taking care of our employees through initiatives such as hybrid work to support work-life balance, health and insurance plans (may differ per country/office), pension plans, paid parental leave, social happenings and competitive salary packages. Please see https://career.mercell.com/posts/our-perks-benefits to get more insights on what to expect of perks, benefits and culture when joining Mercell.
   

  

****Has this sparked your interest?****
 Then we can't wait to have you join our mission and looking forward to receiving your application!
   

  

*We may carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. This background check is carried out by an external party and is not carried out without the consent of the applicant. Current applicants will receive further information about this.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you want to shape how customer data drives strategic decisions across some of the most forward-thinking fashion brands?
   

  

 At Portfolio Brands Central, you’ll be part of a small and agile team building the data foundation that powers customer growth. You’ll work hands-on with modern cloud technologies while influencing how data is used to personalize experiences, optimize marketing, and support business development across COS, Weekday, & Other Stories and ARKET.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
 As a Data Engineer, you will:
   

  

* Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrated data products across multiple brands.
* Develop and optimize data flows using Google Cloud Platform (GCP), ensuring secure and efficient data movement.
* Collaborate with CRM and marketing teams to enable personalized customer journeys and insights.
* Support the migration and enhancement of existing solutions, including real-time data integrations.
* Take ownership of data governance, security, and compliance within your solutions.
* Contribute to the strategic foundation of our data architecture and help shape how we grow with customer data.
* Enable data-driven insights by providing clean, structured, and well-documented datasets for experimentation and analytics.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of a small and collaborative data team belonging to a Customer Activation and Analytics Business function, working at the heart of our customer growth agenda. In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with CRM and Marketing stakeholders from COS, Weekday, & Other Stories and ARKET, as well as tech specialists across the H&M Group. Together, we build scalable and secure data solutions that support all Portfolio Brands, enabling smarter decisions and more personalized customer experiences.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* A few years of experience in building data pipelines and working with cloud platforms (GCP preferred).
* Proficiency in Python and/or Java, with experience using Python for data analysis or machine learning (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn) considered a plus.
* Solid knowledge of SQL and data modeling techniques.
* Experience with Terraform and dbt.
* Familiarity with CI/CD principles and a DevOps mindset.
* Understanding of data governance and security best practices.
* Ability to translate data insights and technical solutions into actionable recommendations for cross-functional teams.


 And people who are…
   

  

* Curious and proactive, with a passion for data and problem-solving.
* Strong communicator who can explain technical concepts in a simple way.
* Collaborative and inclusive, thriving in cross-functional teams.
* Strategic thinker with a hands-on attitude.
* Interested in working at the intersection of business and technology
* Bonus: Interest in fashion and customer behaviour.


 Additional Information
   

  

 This is a full time permanent contract based at our Head Office in Liljeholmen Stockholm
   

  

 If you feel this opportunity is exciting feel free to apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than the 18/11. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 In this role you will have the flexibility to work both remotely and, from the office. While remote working is part of our offer, approx. 4 days per week office presence is required to foster strong collaborations and team work.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 At H&M Portfolio Brand we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people who share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, what we perceive as possible and how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world, therefore all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 We offer all our employees attractive benefits with broad development opportunities. All our employees receive a staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to this, H&M-based colleagues also receive:
   

  

* 30 days holiday
* A collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Benify Benefits Portal


 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you

title: Application Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
 Kambi is a B2B provider of premium sports betting services seeking an Application Engineer to join its Engineering Operations team, focusing on deployment pipeline management, continuous delivery, and collaboration with development teams to ensure scalable system delivery on cloud and on-premise infrastructure. The role requires proficiency in Python, scripting, and technologies like Linux, automation, cloud computing (preferably AWS), and container architecture, offering a flexible, international work environment with agile methodologies and opportunities for professional growth.
   

  

**This is what our Application Engineers do:**
* Manage and support operation supporting systems and functions
* Build and maintain the continuous delivery platform so we can deploy frequently and reliably to multiple sites across the globe


**You'll like Kambi if you:**
* Have high expectations of yourself and your peers
* Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
* Comfortable to work in a production environment
* Think common sense goes a long way


**You'd like to work with these technologies:**
* Linux Debian
* Configuration Management
* Automation
* Message queue, Event Streaming and Repository
* Orchestration
* Cloud Computing preferably AWS
* Container architecture


**We expect you to:**
* Be a team player
* Be fluent in Python and scripting.
* Have the mindset and skills to become an effective part of a cross-function, self-organizing, self-managing team


**What’s in it for you?**
* Opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company
* A (fun and) flexible working culture
* Ability to directly influence your and your teams’ work environment and processes
* Work with very smart and humble people
* Management who understands and appreciates agile
* International work environment


 If you want to be part of a very dedicated community of dev-ops practitioners in central Stockholm. Please apply below.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Global Quality and Service Manager
description:
The ideal candidate is a critical thinker who will proactively improve the quality systems of the company through internal audits, participation in process improvement programs, and interaction with key partners to obtain constructive feedback.
 



  





**Job Responsibilities:** 




  





**Quality Management Strategy** 
 :
 


* Develop, implement, and continuously improve a global quality management strategy that aligns with brand positioning, business objectives, and customer expectations.
* Establish and maintain a global quality system, ensuring consistent product quality, service excellence, and regulatory compliance across all regions.



  





**Service Excellence Framework** 
 :
 


* Define and lead the creation of a customer service excellence framework that is consistent with brand identity, ensuring superior service delivery across all customer touchpoints.
* Develop and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for quality and service, ensuring continuous improvement in all service-related metrics.



  





**Standard Development & Documentation** 
 :
 



  




* Design, implement, and document global quality standards and service protocols, ensuring they are aligned with international best practices and corporate standards.
* Oversee the training and certification of teams to ensure compliance with established quality and service standards.



  





**Global Coordination & Collaboration** 
 :
 



  




* Lead cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of quality and service management initiatives across all global markets.
* Work closely with product development, operations, and customer service teams to drive product and service improvements based on customer feedback and quality audits.



  





**Customer Feedback and Continuous Improvement** 
 :
 



  




* Establish mechanisms for gathering and analyzing customer feedback, ensuring it is incorporated into the continuous improvement of products and services.
* Work with regional teams to resolve customer complaints and quality-related issues in a timely and efficient manner.



  





**Reporting & Performance Analysis** 
 :
 



  




* Regularly report on quality and service performance, providing actionable insights and recommendations to senior management to support decision-making processes.



  





**Qualifications and Requirements:**




  





**Education** 
 :
 


* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Quality Management, or a related field.



  





**Experience** 
 :
 



  




* Minimum of 8 years of experience in quality management, service management, or a related field, with at least 3 years in a global or regional leadership role.
* Proven experience in managing quality and service standards for an international premium brand, preferably in the consumer goods, appliance, or technology sectors.



  





**Skills** 
 :
 


* Strong understanding of global quality management systems (ISO 9001, Six Sigma, etc.) and service excellence frameworks.
* Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and develop strategies to improve performance.



  





**Leadership** 
 :
 


* Proven leadership and people management skills, with the ability to inspire, develop, and guide global teams to achieve high standards.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, capable of building relationships with key stakeholders across various regions.



  





**Knowledge** 
 :
 


* In-depth knowledge of customer service management principles and quality assurance processes.
* Familiarity with global regulatory requirements and industry standards for product quality and service delivery.



  





**Languages** 
 :
 



  




* Fluency in English (written and spoken) is mandatory. Additional language proficiency (e.g., German, French) is a plus.



  





**Travel** 
 :
 


* Willingness to travel internationally as required to support global operations and business needs.

title: System Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga grunden för framtidens digitala standarder och säkra informationsflöden? GS1 Sweden söker nu en System Engineer som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för några av deras viktigaste system och plattformar, en roll för dig som trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik, förvaltning och innovation.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som System Engineer på GS1 Sweden blir du en nyckelperson i att säkerställa driftsäkerhet, datakvalitet och fortsatt utveckling av verksamhetskritiska system. Du tar ett helhetsansvar för förvaltningen av definierade system och plattformar, från planering och uppföljning till säkerhet, tillgänglighet och leverantörssamverkan.
 



  





 Du arbetar nära kollegor inom IT Operations, produktägare, utvecklare och externa partners för att skapa stabila, effektiva och säkra lösningar. Rollen spänner över både teknik och verksamhet, och ger dig möjlighet att påverka hur GS1 driver digitalisering och standardisering i en global miljö.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Du bidrar till att ständigt förbättra våra verksamhetskritiska system, vi gillar när saker blir lite bättre varje dag!
* Du håller koll på, planerar och berättar om nya releaser som utvecklas enligt GS1s roadmap, så att alla är med på tåget.
* Du ser till att nödvändiga systemuppgraderingar och buggfixar blir gjorda och kommunicerade, så att vår IT-plattform alltid är modern och säker.
* Du leder eller är med i projekt där du får använda din tekniska kompetens och samarbeta med andra.
* Du ser till att vi har bra övervakning och larm vid eventuella driftstörningar eller säkerhetsincidenter, och agerar snabbt när det behövs.
* Du säkerställer att våra leverantörer håller vad de lovar i sina SLA:er.
* Du ser till att dataflöden och datakvalitet håller hög nivå, både internt och tillsammans med våra kunder.
* Du hjälper till att våra avtal och processer med leverantörer verkligen täcker verksamhetens behov av tillgänglighet och säkerhet.
* Du erbjuder avancerad support, ibland själv, ibland tillsammans med kollegor eller leverantörer.



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi tror att du har en bakgrund inom IT och ett genuint intresse för system, teknik och smarta lösningar. Du gillar struktur, tar gärna ansvar och tycker om att ha koll på hela systemflöden, från drift till utveckling. Du samarbetar lätt med kollegor, partners och kunder, och kan förklara tekniska frågor på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt. Som person är du självgående, analytisk och noggrann, och du uppskattar ordning, dokumentation och att bygga processer som håller över tid.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Akademisk utbildning inom IT eller teknik
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av systemförvaltning och/eller utveckling
* Grundläggande kunskaper i systemförvaltning och projektledning
* Erfarenhet av affärssystem
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av ITIL eller motsvarande förvaltningsmetodik
* Erfarenhet av projektmetodik
* Systemkunskaper inom MS Bussiness Central
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt
* Erfarenhet från arbete med artikelinformation eller datadrivna system



  





**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar GS1 Sweden med Computer Sweden Recruitment.
 



 Vid frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Britta Liljegren, Rekryteringskonsult, på 070-711 811 eller britta.liljegren@csrecruitment.se.
 



 För att ansöka, skicka in ditt CV eller ansök via LinkedIn. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. I rekryteringsprocessen ingår tester, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll.
 



  





**Om GS1 Sweden** 




*Visste du att du möter oss dagligen. Varje gång det säger bip i en kassa, aktiveras en av våra standarder – streckkoden. Idag använder mer än två miljoner företag globalt GS1s standarder. Vissa branscher använder flera av våra standarder och tjänster och har kommit längre på sin resa att utveckla ett digitalt affärsspråk. I Sverige har dagligvarubranschen kommit långt men vi jobbar även aktivt med foodservice, bygg, detaljhandeln, apotek, sjukvård, transport- och logistik. Idag har vi fler än 15 000 kunder.* 




  





*GS1 Sweden är not-for-profit och för att leverera kundnytta arbetar vi tillsammans med våra användare. Det vi gör, gör vi utifrån våra kunders behov och efterfrågan. All utveckling och underhåll av GS1:s standarder och tjänster sker tillsammans med våra användare. Våra användargrupper är öppna för alla kunder och alla våra standarder är branschneutrala.* 




*Vi är cirka 75 anställda, alla med olika kompetens och bakgrund. Vi håller till på vårt moderna kontor mitt i centrala Stockholm och i vår studio i Hammarby Sjöstad. Våra medarbetare tar ofta initiativ till roliga aktiviteter på, och efter jobbet. Vad sägs om hälsosatsningar, lunchlöpning eller varför inte ta en kort paus i vår återhämtningsfåtölj? Mer information finns här på gs1.se eller LinkedIn.*

title: Team Manager
description:
*Vi på Bankgirot har gjort ett aktivt val att ta ansvar för något större än oss själva: Sveriges betalsystem. Sedan 1959 har våra produkter påverkat miljoner människors liv varje dag. Vi är i en omvandling där du som ledare har en avgörande roll. Nu söker vi fyra Team Managers till området Infrastructure Services och grupperna Technology Security, Network & Datacentre, Platform Operations & Mainframe och Virtualization & Automation.*
**Om rollen**
 Som Team Manager på Bankgirot kommer du ha personalansvar för ett team på 11-15 personer i en miljö där säkerhet, innovation och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Teamet består av Tech leads, Engineers och Service Managers, där ditt uppdrag blir att bygga ett starkt team där människor trivs, växer och känner ansvar för helheten. Du omsätter strategier till handling, skapar struktur och ser till att arbetet bedrivs effektivt och med hög kvalitet. Du behöver ha tillräcklig teknisk förståelse för att kunna delta i dialoger och förstå teamets utmaningar.
   

  

 I den här rollen kommer du samarbeta nära andra delar av verksamheten, både inom IT och med våra säkerhetsfunktioner, och bidrar aktivt till ständiga förbättringar och utveckling av våra arbetssätt. I rollen ingår också ansvar för budget, riskhantering och att driva tvärfunktionella initiativ tillsammans med dina chefskollegor.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som vill bygga något som består, och som vet att tryggt ledarskap är nyckeln. Du vet att framgång inte bara handlar om teknik, utan om att få människor och organisationer att lyckas tillsammans. Du är en kommunikativ och närvarande ledare med erfarenhet av att leda team i en föränderlig miljö.
   

  

 Du har troligen:
   

  

  

* Minst 3–5 års erfarenhet som personalansvarig chef, inom IT-drift, infrastruktur eller liknande teknisk miljö.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning, leverantörssamverkan och budgetansvar.
* Förmåga att fatta beslut även med begränsad information och ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt.


**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Ants Tech Recruiters. Vid frågor eller funderingar, kontakta Ellika Ulltin på ellika.ulltin@ants.se eller 072-230 00 28.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, så tveka inte att ansöka redan idag. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper i den här rekryteringen. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm.
   

  

 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) om tjänsten innebär arbete med säkerhetsklassade uppgifter eller säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Technical Field Engineer
description:
Ready to Power Progress in the Nordics? Become Our Next Nordic Technical Field Engineer - Industry Lubricants
   

  

**Employment** 
 Full time, permanent
   

  

**Start** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Location** 
 Home based covering primarily Sweden and Finland, with travel across the Nordic countries
   

  

 Are you passionate about helping industrial customers achieve their strategic goals while optimizing production, reducing total cost of ownership, and lowering their carbon footprint?
   

  

 At TotalEnergies, we don't just sell lubricants - we enable transformation. As our Nordic Technical Field Engineer, you'll be at the heart of driving sustainable performance across a diverse and dynamic industrial landscape. You'll work hand-in-hand with our sales teams to deliver high-impact technical solutions that support our ambitious growth plans and contribute directly to our business success.
   

  

 You will report to the
 **Lubricants Industry Sales Manager Nordic** 
 and be part of a
 **committed and engaged Lubricants industry team** 
 .
   

  

 This is your opportunity to join one of the world's leading energy companies and make a real difference - not just in our business, but in the future of industry.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 Technical support and Customer support
   

  

* Train and advise sales teams and customers on industrial products and technical services
* Provide technical assistance to customers together with Sales. E.g. technical audits, inspections and open gear cleaning at customer sites, actively demonstrating Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) approach.
* Maintain the services associated with the sale (audits, analysis, lubrication software, grease plans, briefing notes, arguments, etc.).
* Participate in sales training and product courses.
* Handle technical complaints in collaboration with HQ.
* Participating in international Technical Meetings
* Ensure application of Health, Safety, Environment & Quality policy of the TotalEnergies Nordic Hub.


 Sales and business development
   

  

* Collaborate with the Sales Managers to achieve the sales objectives
* Participate in sales meetings, courses and other customer events
* Visit customers and prospects and participate in the identification of growth opportunities
* CRM system Responsible for accurate and updated information


**What You Bring To The Table**
 Professionally
   

  

* Bachelor of Chemical Sciences/engineer and/or 3-5 years of experience in a similar position
* Documented technical knowledge of industrial processes, equipment and lubrication applications
* Comprehensive experience in the Industrial lubricants business and the various product segments and ability to master the main aspects of this activity
* Customer management and sales experience
* High level of customer and technical orientation
* Solid Microsoft Office skills
* Fluency in Swedish or one of the Nordic languages and English is mandatory. French is an advantage but not required.


 Personally
   

  

 You're a confident communicator who connects easily with people at all levels - from the factory floor to the boardroom. Proactive and self-driven, you thrive on solving challenges and making things happen. Your structured approach and sharp planning skills help you stay focused on what matters most, even in fast-paced and demanding environments.
   

  

 You're energized by being on the move, motivated by travel, and unfazed by pressure. You know how to prioritize, adapt, and deliver - always with the customer's success in mind.
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

* Home based office
* Travel activity 2-3 days a week
* Geographical preference Mid- Sweden


**What We Bring**
* A flexible job where you have the chance to shape your own daily routine
* Becoming part of an international company with a high diversity
* Continuous training and development - up to 5 days a year
* Competitive compensation package including company car


**Come join one of the world's major players in the global energy transition**
 TotalEnergies is a broad energy company that produces and markets oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables, and electricity. With over 100,000 employees, TotalEnergies is committed to better energy that is more affordable, more reliable, cleaner, and accessible to as many people as possible. We are the largest oil and gas operator in Denmark, but our vision is clear when it comes to supporting the transition towards a low-carbon future.
   

  

**Safety - Respect for Each Other - Pioneer Spirit - Stand Together - Performance Minded**
**Interested?** 
 For this recruitment, we are partnering with Jefferson Wells, a ManpowerGroup company. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible Recruitment Consultant, Sara Bahlenberg, at +46 70 790 86 26 or sara.bahlenberg@jeffersonwells.se. We review applications on a rolling basis, so please submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Human Resources Director/Leader Seeking Change
description:
*“The best way to predict the future is to create it.” – Peter Drucker* 




  





 Have you been wondering what your next chapter could be.
 
 If you’re ambitious enough to see beyond traditional career boundaries and inspired by the idea of aligning with a
 **global leader in transformation** 
 — this is your opportunity.
 



  





 We partner with a
 **globally recognised organisation** 
 at the forefront of the
 **personal growth and transformation industry** 
 .
 


* A presence in
 **100+ countries** 
 , reaching thousands of professionals worldwide
* **Award-winning programmes and live events** 
 that have transformed lives and careers on a global scale
* A
 **proven, world-class system** 
 trusted by high-achieving professionals from diverse industries



  





**About the Opportunity** 




 You’ve led transformation within organisations. Now it’s time to lead it within yourself and others.
 



 This pathway allows you to:
 


* **Attract like-minded professionals** 
 who are ready for change. The world of work is changing rapidly, and new skills and professional pathways are needed.
* Hold powerful
 **discovery calls** 
 with individuals exploring new directions who are looking for a richer, more fulfilled life where work life balance has become an ever-increasing goal.
* Introduce
 **globally respected transformation programmes** 
 that deliver measurable results. You will have meaningful conversations with people helping them to understand their goals and guiding them to the right solution.
* **Coach and mentor business owners** 
 , sharing your HR and leadership expertise. Using your problem-solving skills, insight and mindset mastery you will help them develop resilience, an orientation for action and a deep desire for self-improvement.
* Immerse yourself in
 **personal transformation and lifelong learning** 
 while building a rewarding, independent career. Learn new ways of thinking, putting theory into practice in a practical and meaningful way.



  





**What We Offer** 



* Fully remote, flexible opportunity – minimum 15 hours per week
* Step-by-step training in digital skills, online marketing & lead generation
* Access to
 **award-winning transformation programmes and international events**
* A
 **prestigious community of ambitious professionals** 
 committed to excellence
* Mentorship, support, and continuous personal growth
* **High performance-based rewards and bonuses** 
 that recognise drive and results



  





 We’re seeking
 **driven, ambitious HR leaders** 
 who are:
 


* Ready to
 **reinvent their careers** 
 and embrace change
* Motivated by growth, recognition, and impact
* Natural mentors who want to empower others while creating success for themselves
* Curious, bold, and committed to lifelong learning
* Set to embrace a self-driven opportunity



  





 Apply today and take the first step toward your next chapter.

title: Cyber Defence Specialist
description:
Vi söker en strukturerad, trygg och samarbetsorienterad Cyber Defence Specialist med fokus på att utveckla morgondagens sätt att driva, följa upp och utveckla vår tekniska säkerhetsförmåga. Du har inte bara teknisk förståelse, utan även en stark insikt i betydelsen av samordning, dokumentation och att vara ett stöd för teamet i en komplex och krävande leveransmiljö.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som trivs med att skapa struktur och tydlighet – även när förutsättningarna förändras snabbt. Du kommer in i en miljö i stark tillväxt, där din förmåga att etablera arbetssätt och bygga hållbara processer blir avgörande.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Cyber Defence Specialist kommer du att
   

  

  

* Säkerställa struktur, ramverk och dokumentation på cybersäkerhetsområdet
* Följa upp leveranser och bidra till samsyn inom teamet
* Vara ett nav mellan teknik, verksamhet och ledning
* Kravställa, deltaga i implementation och medverka i uppföljning och hantering av Bankgirots säkerhetsförmågor
* Göra löpande analyser av Bankgirots säkerhetsförmågor och hotbild i cyberdomänen
* Utveckla och implementera IT-säkerhet samt Cybersäkerhetsstrategi och styrning
* Stödja vid inköp och implementering av nya IT-tjänster och se till att nya system uppfyller den nödvändiga säkerhetsnivån


 Du behöver inte vara specialist inom alla områden – men du har en god bredd, förstår grunderna, kan identifiera risker och vet när du ska koppla in rätt expertis.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du är en person som
   

  

  

* Tänker helhet snarare än silos
* Är strukturerad, kommunikativ, förtroendeingivande och samarbetsinriktad
* Har god strukturförmåga och drivs av att skapa ordning
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta inom Cybersäkerhet


 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper i rekryteringen. Vi söker dig som har ett stort självledarskap och som tar ägarskap för sina frågor. Du har en mycket god kommunikativ förmåga och en vana av att bemöta målgrupper på olika nivåer, i olika forum.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du tycker om att samarbeta och nå resultat tillsammans med andra. Du är lyhörd, duktig på att bygga relationer och skapar förtroende. Som person är du trygg och prestigelös, inkännande och har ett strategiskt förhållningssätt. Vidare är du positiv, drivande och kan prioritera och planera ditt arbete väl.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med eData Solutions AB. För mer information om tjänsten och rekryteringsprocess, vänligen kontakta Daniel Ruja på daniel@edata.se. Läs mer om tjänsten här.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan snarast, dock senast
 **4 augusti 2025** 
 . Vänligen notera att urval och intervjuer kan ske kontinuerligt. Tillträde sker så snart som möjligt med hänsyn till uppsägningstid.
   

  

 Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och kommer att kräva säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Engineering Manager to Software Engineering
description:
*At NOBA Bank Group, we are unlocking new possibilities as we enter an exciting phase with great untapped potential! As the Engineering Manager for one of our Software Engineering teams, you will play a crucial role in both leading daily deliveries and engaging in strategic discussions with Product and Technology leadership. This is your opportunity to shape our technology landscape and create real business impact.*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 to join our Software Engineering department in Stockholm. You will lead a team of 5 engineers responsible for customer onboarding for our Nordax brand, specializing in secure loans. Working closely with the Product Owner and Head of Tech Nordax, you will drive your team’s deliveries while staying engaged with the technical direction and decisions related to software development
   

  

 As Engineering Manager, you will work across the full stack, developing new web services, improving system usability, and maintaining existing solutions. This role is perfect for someone with strong technical skills who wants to stay close to software development while also mentoring and leading a team.
   

  

**Specific Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* Leadership & coaching – Guide, mentor, and support your team members.
* Cross-team collaboration – Drive initiatives across multiple teams and domains.
* Business impact – Ensure business objectives are met and project deadlines are achieved.
* Technical leadership - Support your team making technical decisions as responsible for your teams deliveries
* Process improvement – Uphold and refine development best practices and ways of working.
* Recruitment & growth – Help build and strengthen the Software Engineering organization by hiring top talent.


**We Are Looking For You Who**
 Enjoys leading and supporting others, while staying involved in technical development. You are curious, engaged, and always looking for ways to improve both your own skills and those of your team. You also value close collaboration with fellow Engineering Managers to align and enhance ways of working across teams. For this role you’ll need:
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in software development with C#/.NET/.NET Core.
* 3+ years of experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (preferably React).
* 2+ years of formal leadership experience.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft’s development stack and lifecycle tools.
* Experience working with SQL.
* Fluency in English (written & spoken).
* Experience in hiring, goal-setting, coaching, and performance reviews.


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Public cloud platforms (preferably Azure).
* Test-driven development (TDD) or similar methodologies.
* Continuous Integration & Continuous Deployment (CI/CD).
* Scrum Master responsibilities.
* Fluency in Swedish.


**Our Offer To You**
* Freedom with responsibility
* Career Development
* Feedback Culture
* Coaching Leadership
* A strong caring company culture – we really care about each other!


 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data here.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Product Manager - Production and Planning
description:
Silex Microsystems is the world’s leading pure-play MEMS foundry. We customize for prominent global clients in industries such as pharmaceuticals, consumer electronics, and the automotive industry. We were founded in 2000 in a KTH lab by, among others, current CEO Edvard Kälvesten. Our headquarters and factory are located in Järfälla.
   

  

**About the role:**
 We are looking for a Product Manager - Production and Planning to support Silex in achieving our On-Time Delivery goals. In this role, you will be the primary contact between our production team and customers, as well as external vendors. You will be responsible for planning product from order to delivery and play a critical role in managing product improvements while ensuring that all product-related data and systems are up to date.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Be the primary point of contact for customers on production-related matters, including delivery schedules, updates on plans, and technical inquiries.
* Follow up on status and movement throughout the production cycle.
* Plan and manage regular shipments, including preparing paperwork and following up on deliveries.
* Monitor and control product starts, ensuring timely execution and delivery.
* Manage Work-In-Progress (WIP) updates and track production flow through the fab.
* Responsible for Product Quality and ensure that we follow our Customer Product Integration (CPI) process.
* Support the development of new WIP management and planning tools.


**We are looking for someone who:**
* Have an engineering Master degree or equivalent within material, nanotechnology, physics, chemical engineer or similar
* Experience in production planning or product management, ideally within a technical or manufacturing environment.
* Strong organizational. leadership and communication skills
* Familiarity with production systems and tools
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and work collaboratively across teams.
* Are fluent in English, Swedish is highly meritorious


**More About The Recruitment Process**
 We apply an ongoing recruitment process and therefore encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible. To apply, please attach your CV and answer a few questions.
   

  

 In the process, we work on a competence-based approach, and it will include a personality and logic test, as well as reference checks. We will also conduct both a background check and a drug test before employment. As an employer, we also carry out random alcohol and drug tests on all employees.
   

  

**Silex** 
 is the world’s largest and most advanced pure-play MEMS foundry. With a team of expert engineers, operators, technicians, engineers, support staff, specialists, and much more besides, Silex transforms the visionary ideas of the world’s leading MEMS innovators into reality.

title: Mobile Core Operations Engineers
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?**
 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.
   

  

 We are now looking for two
 **Mobile Core Operations Engineers** 
 to join our
 **Mobile Core** 
 team.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Mobile communications have entered the fifth generation, and the demand for fast, reliable, and secure mobile services continues to grow across society. We already serve millions of users who depend on our network every day—and with the evolution of true 5G, mobile connectivity will become even more critical.
   

  

 At the heart of this transformation is the Mobile Core: the central component where most services are created, managed, and delivered. The pace of innovation in this area is rapid—traditional network “boxes” have evolved into cloud-native, data center-based solutions.
   

  

 Our Mobile Core team is responsible for both development and 24/7 operations across the entire domain. This includes architecture and design, fault and change management, performance monitoring, testing, automation, troubleshooting, and more. We work in agile teams, adapting in size depending on the task, and always strive to match the right expertise to the right challenge.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a member of the Mobile Core team, you’ll play a key role in ensuring our network remains robust, scalable, and always available. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Participating in the design and implementation of new Mobile Core features and services
* Monitoring and analyzing network performance to proactively identify and resolve issues
* Managing incidents and troubleshooting faults in a mission-critical, 24/7 environment
* Driving automation and continuous improvement across operations and workflows
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery
* Contributing to testing, validation, and deployment of new releases and upgrades


 This is more than just a technical role—it’s an opportunity to shape the future of mobile communications and make a real impact on the services millions rely on every day.
   

  

**Are you the one we’re looking for?**
 We need someone who’s always on their toes! You have a genuine desire to learn and develop so we can continue to meet our customers’ ever-changing needs – today and tomorrow.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative setting and is passionate about mobile technology. You are familiar with some of the following areas, either from studies or from work life. Expertise in all of them is not expected:
   

  

**Technologies & Infrastructure**
* Operating systems (Linux)
* Containers, microservices and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker)
* IP Networking (DNS/Firewall/Routing), Open vSwitch, NGINX, Container Networking interfaces
* Hyperconverged Storage Solutions (Ceph/Rook)
* Mobile Networks (3GPP knowledge)


**Automation**
* Configuration Management (Git, Helm, YAML)
* Software supply chain CI/CD (Jenkins)
* Logging (Fluentd)
* Fault Management (Alert Manager)
* Scripting and Programming (Bash, Python)
* Metrics Collection and visualization (Grafana, Prometheus, Victoria Metrics)
* Continuous testing tools / Test automation
* DevSecOps practices


 Experience from Ericsson cloud native systems and Swedish language skills is a bonus.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.
   

  

 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager Kenneth Radebo at kenneth.radebo@telenor.se. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email. Last application date is 30th of November 2025.
   

  

**Our promise to you**
**We are better together.**
 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

**We support relationships and societies.**
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**We make room for life.**
 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

**We invite you to a career in motion.**
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments. This role will require Swedish security clearance. On-call duties is a part of this position.

title: Account Manager
description:
TEKsystems’® unmatched success in the IT Services and Talent Management marketplace is driven by one thing – our employees. A thriving IT industry has caused us to grow at a rapid pace and we are looking for Account Managers to join our team. We offer great opportunities for advancement, personal and professional growth, and unlimited earning potential.
 



  





 TEKsystems seeks professional individuals with competitive spirit, drive, team mentality, commitment, perseverance, and a desire to build a long-term career in a rewarding environment.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 As an Account Manager, you will become an expert in your sales specialism and will be responsible for developing and growing an account base within your designated territory. You will provide insight, conduct deep discovery and demonstrate differentiation to clients to win new business, expand existing accounts, and provide exceptional service to all current and potential clients.
 



  





**The Perks** 



* Competitive base salary
* Uncapped commission.
* Annual all-inclusive company incentive trips.
* Charitable and social responsibility opportunities.
* Health and well-being support



  





**What you will contribute** 



* Working as an Account Manager, your ability to build collaborative and productive partnerships with our team of recruiters will be essential throughout the sales lifecycle to ensure your clients’ hiring needs are fulfilled.
* **You will:**
* Provide insight and demonstrate differentiation to clients to win new business and support the expansion of existing accounts.
* Partner with internal talent delivery teams to ensure client opportunity is sourced and fulfilled, (including oversight of sourcing, screening and onboarding).
* Provide exceptional customer service at all times.
* Have a keen interest in up-skilling on the latest market trends enabling you to act as a trusted advisor to clients.



  





**What you bring to the table:** 



* Two to five years experience in recruitment sales and account management (including proven ability to identify, develop and convert new business opportunities).
* Ability to demonstrate effectiveness in market territory planning.
* Ability to effectively plan and execute a business development strategy.
* Proven experience working in a performance-based environment.
* Passion for networking and communicating both virtually and in person.
* Grit, tenacity, and determination.



  





**Extra Points if you have:** 



* Demonstrable recruitment experience within the technology sector.
* Prior experience using Salesforce CRM tool.
* Exposure to industry standard services sales methodologies (e.g. MEDDIC, Business Value Messaging etc.).



  





**Looking for Career Growth? We’ve got you!** 




 When you choose to join TEKsystems as an Account Manager, we will ensure that you progress your career on your terms. We are structured in such a way that you will have multiple opportunities to choose from. You might continue to become an expert in sales or a leader of one of our high performing sales teams. With us, your career will soar.
 



  





**Supporting Your Career** 




 As an Account Manager, you will be enrolled on our Sales Development Program and receive dedicated time to support your development. With in-house training and
 



 dedicated coaching from leaders as well as tailored online learning modules, you will receive ample professional development to support your career growth.
 



  





 Are You Ready to Invest in Your Future? Let’s connect.

title: 3GPP Security Architect
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be responsible for designing and implementing cybersecurity frameworks and solutions to protect 5G core networks in line with 3GPP security standards.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key role in:*
* Leading the design and implementation of end-to-end cybersecurity architectures for the 5G core network, ensuring alignment with 3GPP security standards
* Applying in-depth knowledge of 3GPP security protocols for 5G networks, including security measures for user equipment (UE), access networks, and core networks
* Conducting comprehensive threat modelling and risk assessments for 5G core network services, identifying potential vulnerabilities and developing mitigation strategies.
* Developing and executing an end-to-end security strategy for the 5G core network, incorporating encryption, authentication, authorization, and data integrity mechanisms.
* Designing and implementing security controls for network slicing within the 5G core, ensuring isolated and secure environments for different service types and customers.
* Leading efforts to detect and respond to cyber incidents within the 5G core network, implementing advanced monitoring, logging, and alerting systems.
* Collaborating with network engineering, operations, and product teams to integrate security measures into the design, implementation, and deployment of the 5G core network.


**Your profile**
* Strong expertise in 5G core network architecture and 3GPP security standards.
* Experience in designing and implementing Cybersecurity solutions for telecom networks.
* Proficiency in 3GPP security protocols such as authentication, encryption, and key exchange.
* Hands-on experience in Threat modelling, Risk assessment, and Incident response.
* Deep understanding of Network slicing security, Encryption mechanisms, and Regulatory compliance (ISO 27001, GDPR, NIST, etc.).
* Swedish citizenship is required.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the 5G and cybersecurity domain, including professional certifications in cybersecurity and Telecom security.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Account Manager
description:
**\*\*Fluent Swedish is essential for this role\*\*** 




  





 TEKsystems’® unmatched success in the IT Services and Talent Management marketplace is driven by one thing – our employees. A thriving IT industry has caused us to grow at a rapid pace and we are looking for Sales Associates to join our team. Once into the world of sales, we offer great opportunities for advancement, personal and professional growth, and unlimited earning potential.
 



  





 TEKsystems® seeks professional individuals with competitive spirit, drive, team mentality,
 



 commitment, perseverance, and a desire to build a long-term career in a rewarding environment.
 



 Don’t worry. No IT experience is needed. We’ve got that covered. Our comprehensive training
 



 programme allows you to learn terminology, job functions, and practice areas within the IT industry.
 



  





 In the Account Manager role, you will learn to provide insight, conduct deep discovery and demonstrate differentiation to clients to win new business, expand existing accounts, and provide exceptional service to all current and potential clients. In short, we will set you up for long-term sustainable success. As an Account Manager, you will then embark fully on your long-term sales career with TEKsystems where you will develop expertise in your sales specialism and will be responsible for developing and growing an account base within your designated territory.
 



  





**What you will contribute** 




 • An understanding of the full lifecycle of IT recruitment

 • Identify, develop, and manage new and existing customer relationships by leveraging our key resources and tools

**What you bring to the table:**

 • Sales Experience engaging with customers in person or via phone preferred or Sales Internship Experience
 



 • Client or customer interfacing experience preferred, ability to cultivate and maintain relationships

 • A sense of urgency, excellent presentation skills and a high standard of professionalism and character

**We are looking for our next great hire! Is that you?** 




**Competencies** 




 • Resilience. Bounces back from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations
 



 • Manages complexity. Makes sense of complex, high quality, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
 



 • Self-development. Seeks new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels
 



 • Collaboration. Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
 



 • Drives results. Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances
 



 • Persuasive. Uses compelling arguments to gain the support and commitment from others
 



 • Customer-focused. Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer-centric solutions
 



 • Planned and aligned. Plans and prioritises work to meet commitments aligned with organisational goals.

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
Looking for your next challenge as an
 **Embedded Software Developer** 
 in the automotive industry? Keep reading!
 



**ALTEN Sweden** 
 is currently seeking a passionate and skilled
 **Embedded Software Developer** 
 to join one of our key automotive clients, working
 **100% on-site in Stockholm** 
 .
 



 You will be part of an experienced and dynamic engineering team developing state-of-the-art embedded software for the next generation of vehicles — focusing on performance, safety, and innovation.
 



  





 🚀
 **WHAT DO WE OFFER** 



* Challenging assignments with leading automotive OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers.
* A strong engineering culture focused on learning and knowledge sharing.
* Supportive leadership and a people-first mindset.
* Continuous opportunities to work with the latest automotive technologies and tools.
* A personal training budget for both internal and external courses.



  





 💻
 **ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 As an
 **Embedded Software Developer** 
 , you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and testing embedded software components within an
 **AUTOSAR-based architecture** 
 .
 



 You will work closely with system architects and test engineers to ensure that software functions meet automotive quality and safety standards. Your daily work will involve
 **C/C++ development** 
 ,
 **model-based design using Matlab/Simulink** 
 , and
 **Python scripting** 
 for automation and testing tasks.
 



  





 Your main responsibilities include:
 


* Develop, integrate, and maintain embedded software modules following AUTOSAR architecture standards.
* Design and implement software components in
 **C/C++** 
 for automotive ECUs.
* Use
 **Matlab/Simulink** 
 for model-based design, simulation, and validation.
* Support system-level testing and verification using
 **Python-based tools** 
 .
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Hardware, Systems, Testing) to ensure optimal performance and integration.
* Participate in code reviews, debugging sessions, and software optimization activities.
* Ensure compliance with automotive quality standards such as ASPICE and ISO 26262.



  





 👤
 **WHO YOU ARE** 




 We are looking for a driven and detail-oriented engineer who enjoys working close to embedded systems and has a deep understanding of automotive software architectures.
 



 Your profile:
 


* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, or related field.
* **3+ years of experience** 
 in embedded software development, ideally within the automotive sector.
* Strong programming skills in
 **C and C++** 
 .
* Solid understanding of
 **AUTOSAR Classic or Adaptive platform** 
 .
* Experience with
 **Matlab/Simulink** 
 for model-based design.
* Experience with
 **Python** 
 for scripting, testing, or automation tasks.
* Familiarity with communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet) is a plus.
* Knowledge of software development processes (Agile/Scrum) and version control (Git).
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.



  





 🏢
 **ABOUT ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies, with over
 **57,000 employees** 
 across nearly
 **30 countries** 
 .
 



 Our engineers work on complex, cutting-edge projects across the entire product development chain for leading companies in industries such as
 **Automotive, Energy, Aerospace, Industrial Equipment, and Life Sciences** 
 .
 



 In Sweden, we are around
 **1,300 professionals across 9 offices** 
 — from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



 ALTEN has been recognized as one of
 **Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen** 
 for five consecutive years — an award that highlights companies offering unique career and growth opportunities.

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for senior developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Web Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Use modern frontend frameworks such as NextJS, Svelte, or Flutter to create amazing digital experiences.
* Engaging with backend languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, or Kotlin to craft scalable integration middle layers.
* Working with contemporary SaaS headless CMS and E-commerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organizations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.
* You have worked professionally as a Web Developer for at least 5 years.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Network Digital Twin Researcher
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Network Digital Twin (NDT) is an emulation of the wireless network, which includes a replica of the core network, hardware and software models of cell sites, models of connected user equipment, as well as models of the surrounding physical world, etc. Because of its ability to analyze and manipulate telecom systems, NDT is considered a key solution paving the way for 6G networks and empowering further network enhancement and growth.
   

  

 The wireless network is an extremely complex, rapidly expanding system. Managing a system of such scale and assuring further growth is becoming impossible without the NDT. In addition to exposing data for new levels of network AI automation, NDT is a key component in realization of 6G applications like Integrated Sensing and Communication (ISAC) and Radio Positioning, facilitating deployment of connected autonomous intelligent systems, making decisions and interacting with the physical world.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Contribute to the research and development of NDT components, such as network simulations, environment 3D reconstruction, etc.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify new challenges and opportunities for NDT realization.
* Become part of a dynamic research environment, with opportunities for learning and growth.


**The skills you bring:**
* M.Sc. or above in electrical engineering, telecommunications engineering, or equivalent.
* Knowledge in channel modelling, radio ray tracing, and stochastic radio models.
* Knowledge in 3D reconstruction or equivalent methods for capturing geometry of physical world.
* Advanced level in Python and C/C++ programming.
* Teamwork mentality as well as strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to bring research ideas into to practice.
* Scientific expertise or work experience in research projects is an advantage.
* Strong communication skills in written and spoken English and good presentation skills.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 776310

title: Implementation Manager
description:
At Upsales, we’re not “another CRM vendor.” We’re building the
 **most advanced AI-driven revenue platform** 
 in Europe. And as our customer base scales rapidly, we need someone who can lead from the front.
   

  

 We’re looking for an
 **Implementation Manager** 
 who combines technical curiosity, polished professionalism, and operational precision. Someone who thrives on helping customers succeed, whether they’re a five-person startup or a seasoned CEO-led company that needs a guiding hand through chaos.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As an Implementation Manager at Upsales, you’ll take full ownership of the customer onboarding experience from the moment the deal is signed. You’ll lead the implementation of our platform, often in high-speed environments where structure is lacking and expectations are high. On any given day, you might be juggling over 10 projects at once, guiding small but ambitious customers through their Upsales rollout, while simultaneously educating marketing managers and facilitating strategic workshops with CEOs.
   

  

 You’ll serve as the bridge between the customer’s vision and our technology, helping them get up and running across CRM, sales processes, marketing automation, support modules, and AI-driven features. You’ll need to quickly understand their business needs, spot technical dependencies, and communicate complex solutions in a way that makes sense, even to non-technical teams. The pace is fast, the scope is broad, and the impact is immediate. If you are structured, confident, and thrive in a high-tempo, high-accountability role, this is where you'll do your best work.
   

  

 AI first mindset
   

  

 We’re not looking for someone who simply uses AI. We want someone who weaponizes it. You treat tools like Claude, ChatGPT, and other AI copilots as force multipliers, allowing you to deliver at a level and speed others can’t match. For you, AI isn’t an add-on, it’s the default operating system for how you think, work, and lead. You’re relentlessly curious about new capabilities, and you push the limits of what’s possible, turning AI into a competitive advantage for yourself, Upsales, and our customers. This is a role for someone with real ambition: someone who wants to set a new standard for efficiency, precision, and impact in the age of AI.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For**
 You’re a
 **true professional,** 
 someone who earns the room’s respect by showing up prepared, knowing your stuff, and making complex things feel simple.
   

  

**You Should Have**
* Years of experience leading CRM implementations (preferably SaaS/enterprise tools)
* A strong technical curiosity
* Experience working with less structured, smaller customers, you know how to guide them, not just follow a checklist
* The ability to drive 10+ projects in parallel without missing a beat
* A structured mindset. You love a good Gantt chart and know how to keep people accountable
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English
* Confidence to run CEO-level workshops, challenge assumptions, and deliver value
* A degree from a respected academic institution, preferably in the technical field
* A get-things-done attitude. We move fast, and so do you


 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: iOS Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Good experience in iOS development, with good knowledge of Swift.
* Familiarity with iOS SDK and various Apple's frameworks and understand how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane to streamline the build, test, and deployment process.
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.


**Application deadline:** 
 18-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Installation coordinator, pharmaceutical manufacturing
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are now looking for someone on behalf of a client who can take the practical main and coordination responsibility for installations and schedules in an investment project in the pharmaceutical industry. Existing premises are to be rebuilt and new equipment is to be installed and for this a coordinated installation responsibility is needed to plan, control, coordinate, follow up and report all cross-disciplinary dependencies so that the project's deliverables can be produced and handed over contractually, safely and on time and with the right quality. This is done by, among other things:
   

  

* Monitoring and following up and coordinating schedules
* Coordinating spaces, drilling, collisions
* Planning logistics and access including lifting and in-transport (also for process equipment)
* Boundary management and ÄTA processes
* Coordinated testing, commissioning and coating, including planning CE marking
* Quality and self-checks, relationship and operation/maintenance documentation
