title: CloudOps Engineer till vår kund i Stockholm
description:
Du får en nyckelroll i att driva och utveckla hybrid cloud-miljöer. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar paketering och deployment av appar i Intune, integrationer och automation i Azure, samt arbete med nätverk och säkerhet. Du blir en viktig del av teamet och har stor möjlighet att påverka teknikval och arbetssätt.

**Arbetsuppgifter**

  

* Hantera och utveckla cloudlösningar, främst i Azure och Intune.
* Paketering och deployment av appar i Intune.
* Automatisera och förbättra processer med CI/CD pipelines.
* Arbeta med nätverk, säkerhet och integrationer i molnet.
* Delta i incident-, problem- och förändringshantering.
* Samarbeta med kollegor och bidra till en trygg och effektiv IT-miljö.

**Vem vi söker?**


Du är självgående men trivs i grupp, har ett öga för säkerhet och erfarenhet av logic apps och cloudlösningar. Du har en bred förståelse för molnteknik och har arbetat med integrationer och deployment i Azure. Du ser helheten och har ett mindset för att driva utveckling framåt.

**Kvalifikationer:**

* Flera års erfarenhet av cloudmiljöer, gärna Azure och Intune.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD pipelines och integrationer.
* God förståelse för nätverk och säkerhet.
* Vana av paketering och deployment av appar.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Logic Apps är meriterande.
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska och svenska.

**Övrigt**

* Start: efter överenskommelse.


* Uppdragsform: Konsultuppdrag, med möjligt övertag till kund i framtiden.

##### **PASSAR VI DIG?**


Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT. Vår uppgift är att hitta rätt person till rätt IT-jobb, genom rekrytering och konsulter. Vi tror på människan i en framtida teknikutveckling och brinner för att bygga relationer, inkludera fler i IT-branschen och naturligtvis matcha rätt kompetens till rätt uppdrag. Vi vill vara en självklar go-to career partner oavsett om kandidaten söker jobb i dagsläget eller inte. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Läs mer om oss, vår kultur och våra värderingar på vår karriärsida.

##### **ANSÖKAN**


Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Johan Karlsson (Johan.Karlsson@wiseit.se). Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
company_description: For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders.

title: Head of Integrated Campaigns and activation
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity**  

We’re seeking a global, results-oriented leader to drive Integrated Campaigns & Activation within Group Marketing and BCSS Marketing & Communications. This role reports to the Head of Campaigns & Digital Marketing and is responsible for building and implementing the marketing activation strategy and plans for Ericsson, covering both Company and Business Area Cloud Software & Services (BCSS). The aim is to strengthen our company positioning, drive thought leadership and BCSS KOA preference and demand and align with business strategy and priorities. You will lead a team comprises campaign and activation specialists leading strategy and structure for integrated campaigns, market activations, and always-on marketing.

 **What you will do**  

* Lead strategy and planning for integrated campaigns and market activations. Drive end-to-end campaign execution, from market analysis and audience insights to positioning and launch planning, while collaborating cross-functionally to align brand, thought leadership, and KOA marketing, delivering measurable business impact, aligned with the company objectives.
* Lead global integrated campaigns for brand awareness and company positioning, by developing and executing creative, omni-channel marketing strategies. Design and implement effective integrated campaign structures to ensure seamless global and local activation. Collaborate cross-functionally to align stakeholders and drive a full-funnel marketing approach targeting core audiences and priority markets.
* Lead BCSS KOA strategic campaign & activations, strengthen our offerings perception, create engagement, drive demand and pipeline growth in our core audiences. Design and implement effective campaign and activation structures and implement an Always on methodology. Collaborate closely with SA Marketing, Strategic Marketing, and the extended cross-functional teams to ensure alignment.
* Drive measurable impact for Ericsson’s perception among target audiences and contribute to topline growth by designing and executing global integrated marketing campaigns including Brand & Awareness, Thought Leadership Topics, and KOAs.
* As Leadership and Capability Development Lead, you will inspire and guide a high-performing team of marketing specialists. You will establish an AI-driven ways-of-working model with clear end-to-end workflows, and lead continuous improvement efforts to increase team effectiveness, efficiency, and business impact.
 **You will bring**  

* 12+ years in marketing, experience leading a marketing organization with a proven ability to implement strategies and tactics, preferably in B2B or technology contexts.
* Compelling storyteller with a track record of delivering end-to-end campaigns that enhance brand, generate leads, and drive sales;
* Strong analytical skills; translates data into action and leverages marketing tech and data with cross-functional collaboration.
* Excellent leadership capabilities; able to influence, work independently, and thrive in a global matrix, with a focus on developing talent.
* Change-driven, strategic, energizing leader who builds cross-functional teams and drives execution.
**Application**


We look forward to your application with CV in English. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond to applications sent via e-mail. We will screen applications prior to publication end date. We target 60% work-from-the office.


Last day to apply is 25th of November 2025.


If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com


Location: Stockholm, Sweden.

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Technical IAM Consultant
description:
**Technical IAM Consultant – Operational Support**


**Purpose of Engagement:**


To provide daily operational support for Identity and Access Management (IAM), focusing on incident resolution, service requests, and change management activities. The consultant will ensure secure and efficient access control aligned with least privilege principles, leveraging the organization's IAM solutions.


**Scope of Work:**


* Handle IAM-related incidents and service requests in a timely and efficient manner.
* Perform technical troubleshooting and resolution of identity-related issues across hybrid environments (on-premises AD and cloud).
* Support change management activities related to IAM configurations, policies, and integrations.
* Maintain and optimize Conditional Access, Identity Protection, and Access Review policies in Microsoft Entra.
* Optimize the use of Microsoft Defender for Identity, including support for threat investigations and remediation.
* Identify and mitigate access risks, focusing on over-privileged accounts and enforcing least privilege principles.
* Ensure operational procedures are documented and up to date, contributing to continuous improvement of IAM services.

**Key Competencies:**


* Strong technical expertise in Microsoft Entra (IdP, MFA, Conditional Access, Identity Governance), management and optimization of apps including review correct app access).
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Defender for Identity, including sensor management and threat analytics.
* Solid understanding of access risk.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a focus on operational excellence.

Good conversational and communication skills  

* 

  

**Beneficial Product Experience**

* Active Directory
* ADFS (Active Directory Federation Services)
* ClearSkye (Identity Governance on ServiceNow)
* CyberArk PAM / CyberArk Remote Access
* Microsoft Entra Connect
* User of ITSM in ServiceNow

**Engagement Type:**


Full-time, based in Stockholm, with hybrid work possibility.


**Working Language:**

*We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.*

title: SOC Team Manager
description:
På Iver söker vi en skicklig Team Manager till vår SOC i Solna, Stockholm. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att leverera toppmoderna cyber säkerhetslösningar till våra kunder. Vi värdesätter innovation och laganda, och vi är särskilt intresserade av personer som tycker om att tänka nytt och dela sina idéer. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Vi stärker vårt nordiska samhälle**
 Iver är en ledande nordisk fullserviceleverantör av IT-tjänster, med spetskompetens inom drift, professionella IT-tjänster, cybersäkerhet, moln och innovation. Våra tjänster är avgörande inte bara för våra kunder utan även för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Iver, med huvudkontor i Stockholm, verkar huvudsakligen i Norden med en tydlig ambition att fortsätta expandera. Företaget omsätter drygt 3 miljarder kronor och har cirka 1 500 anställda fördelade på 25 kontor i regionen. Inom Ivers Managed Service Provider-erbjudande är Cybersecurity en dedikerad avdelning som fokuserar på att leverera specialiserade säkerhetstjänster.
   

  

**Din Roll På Iver**
 Som SOC-team manager ansvarar du för att leda ett team av säkerhetsanalytiker för att säkerställa övervakning dygnet runt, snabb incident respons och kontinuerlig förbättring av våra detekterings och respons funktioner. Du kommer att koordinera verksamheten över olika skift, kvalitetssäkra utav larm hantering och samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att hantera säkerhetshändelser från upptäckt till återställning. Denna roll kombinerar ledarskap, processutveckling och praktisk tillsyn, vilket ger dig möjlighet att forma hur vi levererar SOC-tjänster och handleda nästa generations cyber säkerhetsprofessionella.
   

  

**Typiska Uppgifter**
* Leda, handleda och utveckla SOC-analytiker, säkerställa hög prestanda, kvalitativt larmhantering och professionell utveckling i hela teamet.
* Driva skapandet och förfiningen av SOC-processer, detekteringsinnehåll, responsplaner och integration av hotinformation.
* Hantera SOC-verksamheten över olika skift för att säkerställa kontinuerlig hotövervakning, incidentdetektering och responstäckning dygnet runt.
* Direkt övervakning, triage och responsaktiviteter i realtid, ge vägledning vid incidenter och säkerställa att eskaleringar hanteras effektivt.
* Spåra SOC-nyckeltal, utför kvalitetssäkring av incidentdokumentation och samordna med andra team kring inneslutning och orsaksanalys.


**Vad Som Gör Denna Roll Unik**
 Som SOC-teamchef kommer du att vara den centrala ledarskapspunkten i vår 24/7 säkerhetsverksamhet, med förtroendet att hålla våra detekterings- och responsinsatser effektiva, ändamålsenliga och utvecklande. Denna roll ger möjlighet att forma hur incidenter hanteras, hur analytiker utvecklas och den övergripande kvaliteten som levereras. Du kommer inte bara att leda människor och processer, du kommer också att säkerställa att kunder får snabb och högkvalitativ support under kritiska säkerhetsincidenter. Om du gillar att kombinera ledarskap med praktisk operativ påverkan och vill driva hur vi levererar SOC-tjänster i stor skala, erbjuder denna roll både ansvar och inflytande.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Iver erbjuder fantastiska utvecklingsmöjligheter, och vi finns här för att inspirera dig att nå dina professionella mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer inom ditt specialiseringsområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. På Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättring, testning, utvärdering och att våga förändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser för att vi ska kunna utvecklas.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker någon med dokumenterade ledaregenskaper och flera års erfarenhet av liknande roller, som är självgående, trygg, kommunikativ, organiserad, ödmjuk, samarbetsvillig och serviceinriktad.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har omfattande erfarenhet inom flera av följande områden:
   

  

* EDR/XDR/SIEM-teknik - Eventuellt med fokus på att köra lokala alternativ i stor skala.
* Automatisering – Insikt i hur automatisering kan användas för att effektivt förbättra effektiviteten och förbättra kvaliteten inom ramen för MSSP-tjänsteleveranser, till exempel genom en SOAR.
* Incidentrespons – När det gäller att upprätta incidentresponsplaner och koordinera responsinsatser. Även om detta kan avvikas beroende på kandidatens övriga egenskaper, föredrar vi starkt om du kan delta i vår jourrotation.
* Kundengagemang – Att vara bekväm med att prata med olika nivåer av kundresurser och tillräckligt säker på att kunna hjälpa dem genom deras säkerhetsresa genom att ge rekommendationer och föreslå alternativa lösningar baserat på deras behov.
* Efterlevnad – Några relevanta ramverk är GDPR, NIS2, CIS18, PCI-DSS och NIST 800-61. Åtminstone på grundläggande nivå förstå vikten och konsekvenserna av svenska, nordiska, europeiska och amerikanska geopolitiska fenomen


**Förmåner Hos Oss**
 📄 Kollektivavtal & trygga villkor
   

  

 🏠 Hybridarbete
   

  

 💪 Friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 👓 Terminalglasögon
   

  

 ⏳ Tidsbank – 24 h extra ledighet/år
   

  

 🩺 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension (ITP) & flexpension
   

  

**Plats**
 Iver driver 25 kontor i Norden, med denna roll placerad i vår SOC i
 **Stockholm.**
**Övrig Information**
 Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer, inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet, vilket är anledningen till att vi utför bakgrundskontroller i alla våra rekryteringsprocesser. Ytterligare bakgrundskontroller kan krävas beroende på specifika kunder eller framtida uppdrag.
   

  

**Ansök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före ansökningsdatum. Önskad start är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag: 15 december 2025**
 Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta vår chef för MSS, Robin Carlsson, på robin.carlsson@iver.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att ta emot din ansökan!Send feedback
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**Company Description** 




 Elvy is a new type of energy provider centered on the interests of homeowners. We offer an all-in-one subscription covering a household's energy needs throughout the year with a fixed monthly price and a comprehensive guarantee. Our aim is to provide a warm home, low electricity bills, and a secure energy solution without the hassle of costly investments and uncertain future prospects.
 




  Elvy is Growing! Join Us as a Product Manager
 





 We are seeking a tech-savvy and results-driven Product Manager to play a pivotal role in refining and scaling our core subscription service.
 





 About Elvy and Our Product
 





 Elvy is a software company that provides a unique subscription service centered around managing household projects. Our platform is essential for coordinating several third-party partners (e.g., installers, suppliers, service providers) through a central, managed project lifecycle. This is more than just a SaaS; we provide the operational backbone that ensures successful project delivery for our customers.
 





 The Opportunity: Refactoring and Innovation
 





 We are embarking on an exciting phase of software refactoring and the strategic addition of "missing" features that will unlock significant new value for our users and partners. This role is crucial in defining the path forward, ensuring technical excellence, and driving customer-centric innovation.
 





  What You'll Be Doing (Key Responsibilities)
 





 • Product Strategy & Roadmap: Define and champion the roadmap for the core platform, focusing on both the refactoring effort and the introduction of new, high-impact features.
 





 • Refactoring & Technical Debt: Collaborate closely with engineering to prioritize refactoring efforts, understanding technical trade-offs, and ensuring the final architecture supports long-term scalability and robustness.
 





 • Customer Project Management: Own the product features related to the end-to-end project lifecycle management (from initiation to completion), specifically those that involve coordination with our network of managed partners and customer installations.
 





 • Customer Success Integration (CS): Analyze usage data and feedback gathered by the Customer Success team to identify product gaps and opportunities that improve customer satisfaction and reduce churn.
 





 • Feature Specification: Write clear, concise, and detailed Product Requirement Documents (PRDs) and user stories for development teams.
 





  What You'll Bring (Required Know-How)
 





 • Computer Science (CS) or Engineering Background: A strong technical foundation that allows for effective communication with engineers about architecture and refactoring complexities.
 





 • Project Management Expertise: Direct experience managing or defining software for complex projects, particularly those involving customer installations and multiple external stakeholders/partners.
 





 • Refactoring Experience: Proven ability to manage product roadmaps during significant platform refactoring, balancing new feature development with technical maintenance.
 



* • SaaS/Subscription Experience: Familiarity with the metrics and operational dynamics of a B2B or B2C subscription software model.

title: Test Lead

 You will work closely with development teams at client sites, shaping how testing and quality assurance are done. The work spans from defining strategy and coordinating test efforts to refining QA processes and supporting hands-on testing when needed.

* Define and implement test strategies that scale.
* Coordinate and oversee all QA activities across teams and systems.
* Establish clear reporting, follow-up, and quality metrics.

* Collaborate with developers, testers, and product owners to improve delivery flows.

**Core Experience** 



* Proven experience leading testing in agile environments (Scrum, Kanban).
* Strong coordination and communication skills.

 **manual and automated testing** 
 .

 **integrations across multiple systems** 
 , including

 .

 (Foundation or Advanced).

 test cases.

title: Director of Engineering
description:
**About Acast**
 Since 2014, Acast has been building the world’s most valuable podcast marketplace, creating the technology that connects podcast creators, advertisers, and listeners. Its marketplace spans more than 140,000 podcasts, 3,300 advertisers, and one billion quarterly listens. Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen—across any podcast app or listening platform.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Director of Engineering to lead the core Marketplace Products domain. This is a critical leadership position responsible for the technical platform that powers some of Acast’s primary revenue streams. Your mandate is to lead our teams in building a resilient, scalable, and innovative ad tech platform that can meet the company's multi-year global growth ambitions, ensuring both creators and advertisers experience world-class technology. You will lead Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers, setting the technical vision for all commercial systems.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* People Leadership and Organizational Scaling Lead Leaders: Serve as the people manager for Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers.
* Organizational Design: In partnership with the Director of Product, facilitate the process to co-design the org structure to maximize delivery efficiency, scalability, and foster deep alignment with Commercial and Product teams.
* Talent Development: Drive career paths, coaching, and succession planning. Ensure EMs are empowered to manage technical excellence and maintain a high-performing, psychologically safe engineering culture.
* Hiring and Capacity: Own the long-term headcount planning and budget, leading recruitment efforts for strategic, specialized ad tech and platform engineering talent.
* Technical Strategy and Architectural Ownership Long-Term Vision: Define and drive the technical roadmap 18 months ahead, ensuring the ad tech platform and monetization infrastructure can scale reliably to support exponential listenership and revenue growth, including different ad formats (e.g., video, programmatic).
* Architectural Accountability: Own the end-to-end architecture, focusing on resilience, speed, and real-time data processing.
* Risk and Investment: Advocate for strategic technical investments in core systems and platform components, clearly articulating the ROI of platform health, security, and technical debt mitigation to Executive Leadership.
* Cross-Functional and Commercial Alignment Commercial Partnership: Act as the senior technical counterpart to leadership in Sales, Content, Finance, and Legal/Compliance, translating business needs into robust, scalable engineering solutions.
* Execution Oversight: Ensure consistent execution velocity, high reliability, and rapid incident response across all critical revenue-driving systems.
* Feasibility and Innovation: Partner with Product and Design to explore technical feasibility and opportunities inherent in new ad-tech innovation and creator tools.


**Who You Are**
* The Scaling Leader: You are an experienced engineering leader who thrives at the intersection of Ad Tech, large-scale data systems, and commercial strategy.
* Organizational Architect: Proven experience leading and coaching Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers, with a track record of scaling organizations and defining clear, efficient team structures.
* Ad Tech and Distributed Systems Acumen: Deep conceptual understanding of high-scale distributed systems and experience in domains like Ad Serving, programmatic bidding, real-time data pipelines, or high-volume E-commerce/Marketplace platforms.
* Architectural Judgment: Strong understanding of system design trade-offs at an organizational level (e.g., building platforms vs. specialized applications) and a history of driving technical strategy that maximizes business predictability and stability.
* Communication & Influence: Exceptional ability to communicate technical strategy and complexity across highly varied stakeholders—from technical ICs and EMs to Commercial Directors and the VP Product.
* Technical Foundation Strategic Technical Leadership: You possess the technical depth and credibility to coach managers and engineers on complex architectural decisions. You have a proven background in designing and operating highly scalable distributed systems and can effectively articulate the rationale behind strategic technical trade-offs (speed, cost, quality).
* Broad System Knowledge: A broad understanding of modern software development practices, various technology stacks, data architecture, and infrastructure.


**Qualifications**
* 7+ years of progressive experience in Engineering leadership roles (Senior EM or DoE level). Prior experience leading teams responsible for complex, Ad tech or e-commerce platforms.
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience (e.g., Computer Science). Experience with cloud-native microservices architecture and data-driven decision-making.


**Culture**
 Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.
   

  

 Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.
   

  

 We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.
   

  

 We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

title: Presales Manager, Domain Consulting - Cortex (Northern Europe)
description:
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks®, we’re united by a shared mission—to protect our digital way of life. We thrive at the intersection of innovation and impact, solving real-world problems with cutting-edge technology and bold thinking. Here, everyone has a voice, and every idea counts. If you’re ready to do the most meaningful work of your career alongside people who are just as passionate as you are, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 This role is remote, but distance is no barrier to impact. Our hybrid teams collaborate across geographies to solve big problems, stay close to our customers, and grow together. You will be part of a culture that values trust, accountability, and shared success where your work truly matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
**The Team**
 Our Domain Consultant team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 As part of our team, you’ll support the sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our presales team, you are driven by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As Domain Consultant Manager, you are the technical leader for your Domain Consultant team for Northern Europe (Benelux & Nordics). Your team provides technical expertise and guidance in customers’ security operations transformation journey. You will work closely with the Presales Managers and their District Sales Manager counterparts to build relationships with your customers with the goal of helping them detect and prevent advanced cyberattacks and breaches. You and your team will play a key role in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives and will evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security services that establish Palo Alto Networks as a customer’s cybersecurity partner of choice.
   

  

 We are looking for a leader to develop our Domain Consultant teams, providing training and technical support as a product expert. Additionally, you will provide feedback to the product management team on new feature requests and product improvements based on what you learn from your customer base. Your team, in partnership with the systems engineering team, will displace competitor technologies and build market share within your targeted list of major accounts, and most importantly, help your client sleep at night as they use our products to build secure digital transactions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Recruit and hire new Domain Consultants into the team, hiring the best talent in the industry
* Work with your peers to develop a Domain Consultant training curriculum
* Mentor, train, and review Domain Consultants on your team, keeping them engaged and successful in their careers
* Develop relationships with the Solutions Consultant Managers and their teams to ensure full technology coverage in key opportunities
* Lead your team to innovate and iterate to drive high technical validation and PoC win rates for Cortex solutions, while reducing technical validation and PoC timelines
* Provide effective technical leadership in customer interactions to include sharing security operations trends and standard methodologies employed by other customers to actively be part of the selling process
* Provide Domain Consultant expertise and fill in for existing team members if there is a resource conflict or vacation coverage challenge
* Present to customers as our expert in your area at all levels in the customer hierarchy from technician to CIO
* Lead conversations focused on industry trends and emerging changes to the security landscape
* Discuss competitor offerings in the marketplace and positions ours as the best solution
* Support your team in documenting HLD (High Level Design) and key use cases to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks solutions
* Review and guide your team’s technical validation plans including POV (proof of value) test plans and customer readiness/requirements
* Build and maintain relationships with key customers to solidify reference accounts and to assist the account teams with defining plans to drive more business
* Act as an escalation point for presales and collaborate with post-sales teams for issues that arise
* Work with product teams to build requirements and roadmap development plans for our Cortex customers
* Maintain an understanding of competitor selling strategies and technologies
* Up to 50% travel within assigned region


**Qualifications**
**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience leading customer-facing presales engineering or solutions architect teams
* Significant experience in sales engineering within SIEM, SOAR, SOC, and/or endpoint environments
* Industry knowledge of security operations market trends and awareness of our roadmap and technology development efforts
* Experience delivering comprehensive security solutions
* Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills
* Experience in leading large teams, allocating resources, managing engagements and resource efficiency
* Proficiency in English language skills


**Additional Information**
**Our Commitment**
 We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: iOS Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Good experience in iOS development, with good knowledge of Swift.
* Familiarity with iOS SDK and various Apple's frameworks and understand how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane to streamline the build, test, and deployment process.
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.


**Application deadline:** 
 18-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Mobile Core Operations Engineers
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?**
 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.
   

  

 We are now looking for two
 **Mobile Core Operations Engineers** 
 to join our
 **Mobile Core** 
 team.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Mobile communications have entered the fifth generation, and the demand for fast, reliable, and secure mobile services continues to grow across society. We already serve millions of users who depend on our network every day—and with the evolution of true 5G, mobile connectivity will become even more critical.
   

  

 At the heart of this transformation is the Mobile Core: the central component where most services are created, managed, and delivered. The pace of innovation in this area is rapid—traditional network “boxes” have evolved into cloud-native, data center-based solutions.
   

  

 Our Mobile Core team is responsible for both development and 24/7 operations across the entire domain. This includes architecture and design, fault and change management, performance monitoring, testing, automation, troubleshooting, and more. We work in agile teams, adapting in size depending on the task, and always strive to match the right expertise to the right challenge.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a member of the Mobile Core team, you’ll play a key role in ensuring our network remains robust, scalable, and always available. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Participating in the design and implementation of new Mobile Core features and services
* Monitoring and analyzing network performance to proactively identify and resolve issues
* Managing incidents and troubleshooting faults in a mission-critical, 24/7 environment
* Driving automation and continuous improvement across operations and workflows
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery
* Contributing to testing, validation, and deployment of new releases and upgrades


 This is more than just a technical role—it’s an opportunity to shape the future of mobile communications and make a real impact on the services millions rely on every day.
   

  

**Are you the one we’re looking for?**
 We need someone who’s always on their toes! You have a genuine desire to learn and develop so we can continue to meet our customers’ ever-changing needs – today and tomorrow.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative setting and is passionate about mobile technology. You are familiar with some of the following areas, either from studies or from work life. Expertise in all of them is not expected:
   

  

**Technologies & Infrastructure**
* Operating systems (Linux)
* Containers, microservices and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker)
* IP Networking (DNS/Firewall/Routing), Open vSwitch, NGINX, Container Networking interfaces
* Hyperconverged Storage Solutions (Ceph/Rook)
* Mobile Networks (3GPP knowledge)


**Automation**
* Configuration Management (Git, Helm, YAML)
* Software supply chain CI/CD (Jenkins)
* Logging (Fluentd)
* Fault Management (Alert Manager)
* Scripting and Programming (Bash, Python)
* Metrics Collection and visualization (Grafana, Prometheus, Victoria Metrics)
* Continuous testing tools / Test automation
* DevSecOps practices


 Experience from Ericsson cloud native systems and Swedish language skills is a bonus.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.
   

  

 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager Kenneth Radebo at kenneth.radebo@telenor.se. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email. Last application date is 30th of November 2025.
   

  

**Our promise to you**
**We are better together.**
 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

**We support relationships and societies.**
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**We make room for life.**
 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

**We invite you to a career in motion.**
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments. This role will require Swedish security clearance. On-call duties is a part of this position.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**The role** 




 At GpsGate, you’ll join a growing team full of energy and collaboration. We emphasize knowledge-sharing and teamwork, so you’ll work closely with talented colleagues across departments. Our customer solution engineers partner with sales teams and customers to deliver technical excellence and long-term success. You’ll solve complex challenges, design customer-specific solutions, and act as a key technical contact in both project and support phases.
 



  





 As part of your role, you’ll also provide Level 2 and Level 3 support—investigating, troubleshooting, and resolving advanced issues. You’ll help capture system or platform changes and ensure that our support guides and internal documentation stay up to date.
 



  





**What you'll do** 



* Help customers with their questions and technical issues
* Handle Level 2 and Level 3 support cases, ensuring high-quality investigation and resolution
* Document new findings and system updates to keep our knowledge base and support guides current
* Work with customers to understand their needs and design tailored solutions
* Build, test, and roll out solutions on GpsGate together with customers
* Be the expert on designing reports and writing scripts using specialized business rules
* Train and assist customers via phone, video calls, and workshops
* Develop and maintain relationships with our larger customers from onboarding to long-term support
* Act as your customers’ voice and advocate for their needs with internal teams



  





**Who you are** 




 You’re passionate about helping customers succeed and take pride in delivering robust, elegant solutions. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy teamwork, and love solving technical puzzles. You’re also comfortable working across departments—bridging customers, support, and development teams.
 



  





**You have:** 



* A solution-oriented mindset with empathy for the customer
* Experience in a customer-facing technical or engineering role
* Strong communication skills and an ability to work with customers from diverse cultures and nationalities
* A collaborative attitude and ability to work with sales, developers, and support teams
* A passion for learning, technology, and customer success



  





**Requirements** 



* Experience handling support tickets, including Level 2/3 investigations and escalations
* Ability to capture system or product changes and update internal documentation
* Comfortable creating scripts and reports using JavaScript and SQL
* Solid understanding of servers, operating systems, networking, and mobile communication
* Fluency in both written and spoken English (Portuguese or Spanish is a plus!)

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
**Om tjänsten** 




 Responda Group söker en innovativ och affärsdriven Chief Technology Officer (CTO) som vill leda företagets digitala transformation och tekniska strategi. Som CTO får du en nyckelroll i att forma och driva Respondas tekniska riktning samt säkerställa framgångsrik utveckling och leverans av skalbara och konkurrenskraftiga digitala lösningar. Du ansvarar för teknikteamet och samarbetar nära med andra avdelningar för att säkerställa att tekniken stödjer affärsutveckling och kundbehov. CTO rapporterar direkt till VD och ingår i företagets ledningsgrupp, med placering på huvudkontoret i Stockholm/Kista. Responda är inne i en expansiv fas där IT kommer att vara avgörande för deras fortsatta framgång, med stort inflytande över både strategi och genomförande. Du kommer att driva innovation, harmonisera plattformar och processer, samt stötta organisationen i att ta tillvara på möjligheterna som digitalisering och AI innebär.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden inkluderar:** 



* Sätta och genomföra teknikstrategin i linje med företagets affärsmål
* Leda och utveckla teknikteamet, inklusive rekrytering, coachning och uppföljning
* Ansvara för utveckling, integration och förvaltning av digitala plattformar och verktyg
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet, säkerhet och skalbarhet i alla tekniska lösningar
* Samverka nära med produktledning, försäljning och kundansvar för att säkerställa att tekniken stödjer affärsutveckling och kundernas behov
* Budget- och resursansvar för teknikavdelningen
* Driva innovation och kontinuerlig förbättring av teknik och processer
* Ansvara för företagets outsourcade IT-infrastruktur och säkerställa en stabil, säker och kostnadseffektiv IT-leverans till hela organisationen



  





**Bakgrund och erfarenheter** 



* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda teknikutveckling inom digitala plattformar, SaaS eller liknande teknikintensiva miljöer
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och utveckla högpresterande teknikteam
* Erfarenhet av moderna utvecklingsmetoder, agila processer och kontinuerlig leverans
* God förståelse för IT-säkerhet, infrastruktur och integration av komplexa system
* Erfarenhet av samarbete med tvärfunktionella team och externa partners
* Erfarenhet av leverantörsstyrning
* Akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, teknik eller motsvarande är meriterande
* Det är också meriterande med erfarenhet från branschen



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Vi söker en trygg och stark ledare med förmåga att inspirera, motivera och utveckla team. Du är affärsmässig, lyhörd och kundorienterad med fokus på att leverera värde till både kund och organisation. Du är analytisk, strukturerad och beslutsam, har hög ambitionsnivå och drivs av resultat. Din nyfikenhet och öppenhet för nya idéer, i kombination med mycket god kommunikativ förmåga och förmåga att bygga relationer i hela organisationen, gör dig till rätt person för att driva förändring och innovation på Responda Group.
 



  





**Låter det intressant? Välkommen med din ansökan!** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Charlotta Skogar på charlotta.skogar@novare.se eller 0761-66 48 78. Urval sker löpande så vi ser gärna din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

title: SAP ME Consultant
description:
**Job Summary:** 




 HCLTech is seeking a skilled and experienced
 **SAP ME Consultant** 
 to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in SAP Manufacturing Execution (ME) implementations, integration with SAP MII and ECC/HANA, and a strong understanding of MES lifecycle and customization using SAP ME SDK. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, functional understanding, and excellent communication skills.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



1. Lead or contribute to
 **SAP ME implementation projects** 
 , ensuring successful delivery across all phases.
2. Work across
 **various SAP ME modules** 
 , handling configurations, master data, and object models (ODS, GODS).
3. Customize and extend SAP ME solutions using
 **SAP ME SDK** 
 and deploy custom functionalities.
4. Integrate SAP ME with
 **SAP MII, ECC/HANA** 
 , and other enterprise systems using tools like
 **CPI-DS, SDI** 
 , and
 **SAP Plant Connectivity (PCo)** 
 .
5. Analyze business requirements, perform
 **Fit-Gap analysis** 
 , and create functional and design specifications.
6. Support
 **machine integration** 
 using SAP Plant Connectivity and troubleshoot hardware devices like RF scanners, barcode printers, and tablets.



  





**Mandatory Skills & Expertise:** 




  





 SAP ME Implementation
 



 Expert
 



 SAP ME Modules & Master Data
 



 Expert
 



 SAP ME SDK Customization
 



 Expert
 



 SAP ME Data/Object Models (ODS, GODS)
 



 Expert
 



 SAP MII Integration
 



 Expert
 



 Integration with CPI-DS, SDI, SAP ECC
 



 Expert
 



 J2EE, JSP, EJB, JavaScript
 



 Good
 



 SQL, MS-SQL Server, Oracle
 



 Good
 



 Agile/Scrum Methodology
 



 Good
 



 English Communication (Written & Verbal)
 



 Fluent
 



  





**Desired Skills:** 



* Knowledge of
 **SAP Cloud technologies** 
 and connectors like
 **PCo, SDI** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **network and OS environments** 
 (Windows, Linux).
* Experience in
 **relational database administration** 
 .
* Strong
 **presentation and stakeholder communication** 
 skills.



  





**Why Join HCLTech?** 



* Work on cutting-edge SAP MES projects with global clients.
* Be part of a collaborative and innovative team.
* Access to continuous learning and upskilling opportunities.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Senior .NET Opportunity in Stockholm** 




  





 I am looking for
 *Swedish speaking* 
 Senior .NET Developers in Stockholm to join a company working in the e-commerce space. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in building and maintaining .NET applications, alongside strong experience working with Azure DevOps and Architecture. Bonus points if you've worked with IaC or Microservices.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Develop, maintain, and optimize backend services and APIs using .NET/C# and Azure technologies.
* Design and implement scalable microservices-based solutions in Azure, supporting the transition from a monolithic architecture.
* Apply modern DevOps practices including CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code, and automated testing.
* Integrate and manage real-time data flows.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, provide input into technical decisions and architectural discussions



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 5+ years' experience working with .NET/C#
* Strong experience working with Azure DevOps and CI/CD
* Experience working with Microservice architecture
* Bonus: Experience working with IaC such as Terraform or Bicep.



  





*This role requires candidates to speak fluent Swedish and cannot assist with visa sponsorships.* 




  





**Why join?** 




  




* Work with modern Azure and .NET technologies in a cloud first environment.
* Opportunity to shape architecture and technical decisions in a stable environment with experienced colleague's.
* High technical ownership in which you can decide when to deploy and manage your infrastructure.
* Learning oriented culture with AI opportunities, cross collaboration, and excellent team culture.



  





**Please apply via the Easy Apply function.** 




  





**For more information, please email l.letchford@tenthrevolution.com.** 




  





**The application deadline for this position is the 28th of November, 2025, however applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis so please apply quickly.**

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 As Engineering Manager, you will lead engineers in an engineering area and have formal staff responsibility for several Engineering talents. You are responsible for building a strong engineering culture designing a Community of Practices for your area and enabling and securing strong organizational health by ensuring that you plan for both deliveries as well as competence development. Within your area, you will be responsible for recruiting, staffing, and retaining talents including having a healthy mix of consultants and employees in appropriate tech locations. As Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring that the team can staff initiative in an efficient way according to set goals – with a healthy work/life balance.
   

  

 The EM would play a pivotal role in driving the tech landscape aligning top talent to help our product team to achieve their business objective through exceptional quality and delivery of products.
   

  

**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**
* Acting as the employer's extended arm to follow and implement H&M Group’s vision, goal, strategies, values, policies, and processes, as well as acting as an ambassador, representing the management internally and externally.
* Leading and steering an area with Software Engineers for a set of technology, software, or platform development.
* Supporting your organization’s employee development
* Set objectives and inspire team members based on specific competence needs.
* Performance management and salary reviews
* Stay compliant with laws and policies, and act, when necessary, in regard to e.g., underperformance, work environment, rehab cases, etc.
* Recognize progress towards ambition and goal and required growth.
* Budget responsibility for FTE & FTC budget
* Building a strong organizational health, role & competence development
* Recruitment and retention strategy for talents
* To establish a continuous learning & development activity within your area and contribute to an outside-in vision for competence development.
* Stakeholder management
* Ensuring that your teams have a healthy mix of consultants and employees in the appropriate tech locations.


**YOU HAVE:**
* 10 + years as a technology leader using & implementing modern technology in complex organizations at scale.
* Experience in front-end development.
* 2 + years of experience in managing a team of Software engineers.
* Great stakeholder management skills and collaboration across business units
* Interested in developing people and building an extraordinary engineering culture.
* Sound financial and forecasting skills and experience handling resource allocation budgets.
* Proven experience in building successful communities of practice.
* Cultivate trust and empower others to both responsibilities, dare to fail, learn, and grow.
* Strong interpersonal, collaborative, and communication skills.
* Ability and credibility to lead and guide both in-house and third-party teams.
* Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities


**Functional Knowledge:**
* Strong leadership skills.
* Senior formal manager/staff responsible skills (incl. recruitment, performance development, career planning)
* Workforce planning
* Budgeting and forecasting
* Agentic AI, Gen AI, Successful implementation of AI in automation and engineering efficiency
* Cloud and future proof web application architecture
* Technology development & lifecycles
* Agile and DevOps practices
* Enterprise Architecture concepts
* Cybersecurity and privacy concepts, principles & solutions


**Leadership Behaviors:**
 As a role model for our values and putting them into action, you are expected to demonstrate excellent cognitive, social, and emotional skills and know how to nurture them in others by having the ability to…
   

  

* commit to directional decisions, take ownership of the whole and, collaborate across boundaries.
* communicate in a timely and perfect way.
* strive for speed, reduce complexity, and focus on the outcome.


 … stay curious and be open to new perspectives.
   

  

***Please note:***
 As our culture and teamwork are very important to us, four days (80%) per week of in-office presence in our office are required.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in
 **Stockholm** 
 .

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
description:
**WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING**
 At AMD, our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences—from AI and data centers, to PCs, gaming and embedded systems. Grounded in a culture of innovation and collaboration, we believe real progress comes from bold ideas, human ingenuity and a shared passion to create something extraordinary. When you join AMD, you’ll discover the real differentiator is our culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges—striving for execution excellence, while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. Join us as we shape the future of AI and beyond.
 **Together, we advance your career.**
**The Role**
 AMD is looking for a full-stack software engineer to join the AMD Silo AI, SiloGen applications team. In this role, you’ll help design and build secure and reliable web-based UIs and backend services that support Machine Learning workflows. We’re looking for someone at least
 **2** 
**years of professional experience** 
 in software development, preferably with exposure to both front-end and back-end technologies.
   

  

 You will contribute to the development, testing, deployment, and support of scalable software systems.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack Includes**
* Python
* React
* Typescript
* PostgreSQL
* Kubernetes
* Cloud environments (Oracle and others)
* AMD GPU hardware


**The Person**
 You’re a hands-on engineer who enjoys working across the stack and solving real-world problems. You care about clean code, scalable systems, and impactful collaboration.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Contribute to designing and developing web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies
* Work closely with product, design, and engineering teams to implement new features
* Ensure UI/UX designs are feasible, performant, and user-friendly
* Optimize code and applications for speed, reliability, and scalability
* Participate in code reviews and discussions to support code quality and team learning
* Investigate and help resolve technical challenges
* Stay curious and keep learning new tools and frameworks


**Academic Credentials**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field


**LOCATION:**
 Sweden or Finland
   

  

*Benefits offered are described:* 
 AMD benefits at a glance
 *.*
*AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.*

title: Lead Data Analyst – Advanced Analytics
description:
**Job Description**
 As a Lead Data Analyst focused on Advanced Analytics, you will play a key role in enabling teams across the organization to leverage data science and statistical modeling for smarter decision-making. You will drive the adoption of advanced analytical techniques, foster a culture of experimentation, and support the development of scalable, high-impact analytical solutions.
   

  

 Your work will focus on empowering others through knowledge sharing, mentoring, and the creation of reusable models, frameworks, and methodologies. You will lead initiatives that improve analytical maturity, ensure consistency in the use of predictive and statistical methods, and promote continuous learning and innovation in the use of data.
   

  

 The role requires a high degree of autonomy and initiative, with an emphasis on proactively identifying opportunities to apply advanced analytics to business challenges. Success in this position depends on the ability to navigate a complex, cross-functional environment, build alignment across diverse teams, and drive impactful initiatives that elevate the organization’s overall analytical capabilities. A strong understanding of business context and the ability to prioritize efforts based on strategic needs are essential to ensure that enablement activities deliver tangible value.
   

  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**
* Champion best practices in statistical modeling, machine learning, and experimentation across teams to ensure consistency and quality.
* Proactively identify opportunities to apply advanced analytics to improve decision-making and business outcomes.
* Lead the development of reusable analytical assets, templates, and frameworks that promote scalability and efficiency.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their analytical needs and guide them in applying effective modeling and experimentation approaches.
* Design and deliver training sessions, workshops, and documentation to upskill colleagues in advanced analytics tools, methodologies, and interpretation.
* Monitor the adoption and performance of analytical solutions, gathering feedback and iterating to maximize impact.
* Stay current with emerging technologies and trends in data science and translate them into actionable strategies for the organization.
* Mentor colleagues and contribute to a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
* Lead strategic analytics initiatives that align with business goals and drive measurable value.


**WHO YOU ARE:**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* High proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
* Strong programming skills in Python or R, with experience in machine learning libraries and statistical packages.
* Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
* Solid understanding of statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, and experimental design.
* Experience with data mining, wrangling, and feature engineering techniques.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
* Strong business acumen and the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Advanced presentation skills, with the ability to engage and persuade senior stakeholders with data-driven insights.
* Proven experience in mentoring and upskilling colleagues, including designing and delivering training, creating learning resources, and fostering a collaborative learning environment.
* Continuous learning mindset and ability to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics.


**Why Join Us?**
 At H&M, you’ll be part of a dynamic global team working on one of the most business-critical platforms. This is an opportunity to take on end-to-end technical ownership of a complex system, collaborate across international teams, and contribute directly to how H&M continues to innovate in the fashion and retail space.
   

  

 We offer a collaborative workplace, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a tangible impact in one of the world’s leading retail organizations.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Field Sales
description:
**Job Description**
**Reshape How We Win in the Independent Software Vendors (ISV) Ecosystem**
 At Nexi, we're revolutionizing how payment solutions integrate into the software that powers businesses across Europe. As part of our
 **ISV Field Sales** 
 team, you'll spearhead our next phase of growth in the Integrated Software Vendor space, bringing our innovative solutions to directly to merchants.
   

  

 This is about getting close to small businesses, helping them understand how our innovative partnerships can accelerate their growth and supporting them through the full sales cycle. It’s the perfect role for a high energy, success-driven software salesperson who thrives on face-to-face contact.
   

  

**The Challenge**
 The ISV landscape is evolving rapidly. We have partnerships across Europe with innovative providers, integrating payments into their market-leading commercial products. Now we need to take those product solutions to small and medium sized businesses across Europe, build compelling business cases to solve their problems, and supporting them through the whole sales and onboarding cycle.
   

  

 You'll be identifying and acquiring new customers while working in a busy, international environment with plenty of room for growth
   

  

**Your Mission**
**Hunt and Win ISV customers**
* Identify and engage high-potential customers in the target sectors
* Build compelling sales cases that demonstrate the value of our solutions
* Manage sales process from initial contact through successful onboarding and go live


**Drive Commercial & Technical Partnership Success**
* Develop deep understanding of ISV business models, technical requirements, and integration capabilities
* Collaborate with technical and onboarding teams to ensure seamless onboarding experiences


**Support Partnership Approach**
* Provide market intelligence that shapes our ISV strategy and product development


**Own Revenue Growth**
* Own your revenue targets and growth objectives


**What We're Looking For**
**Partnership Hunter Mindset**
* Revenue Driver: You're motivated by targets and understand how partnerships translate to business growth
* Relationship Builder: You earn trust quickly and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with a real focus on customer success
* Market Challenger: You're comfortable competing and winning in a complex technical market


**Technical & Commercial Expertise**
* Software Sales Experience: Proven track record in B2B software or SaaS sales
* Technical Fluency: Comfortable discussing technical integration requirements with customers, in clear and compelling terms, and collaborating with stakeholders across internal technical functions


**Sales Excellence**
* Track record of achieving revenue targets


**Life at Nexi**
 Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=standard .
   

  

 Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.
   

  

**Apply now!**
 If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

 Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.
   

  

 By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!
   

  

**About Us**
 Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies?
   

  

 Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

title: Presales Solution Consultant, CPQ
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a member of our Solution Consulting team, you will play a pivotal role in accelerating our EMEA revenue growth by supporting CRM, CPQ, and digital commerce solution sales across a range of industries. You will act as a hands-on technical consultant and strategic advisor, collaborating closely with Sales, Product Management, and cross-functional stakeholders to craft customer-centric solutions. This role combines deep technical acumen with strong business insight to drive high-impact engagements throughout the pre-sales cycle.
   

  

**What You Get To Do In This Role**
 The Advisory Solution Consultant is a senior-level technical expert responsible for developing and positioning tailored solutions during the sales process. You’ll guide customers through discovery, design, and demonstration, aligning solutions with their business objectives while helping drive sales performance.
   

  

* Support sales efforts as a technical and domain expert across CRM, CPQ, and automation platforms
* Lead engaging technical discovery sessions and workshops to uncover customer challenges and use cases
* Design and deliver tailored product demonstrations that effectively highlight business value
* Build trusted relationships with both technical and executive stakeholders, including C-level decision-makers
* Provide actionable insights and feedback to Product and Engineering teams to improve offerings
* Share best practices, reusable assets, and industry knowledge with the broader Solution Consulting team
* Stay up to date on market trends, competitors, and emerging technologies
* Represent the company at key marketing and customer events, including workshops, briefings, and conferences


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role, you have:
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in pre-sales solution consulting, sales engineering, or a similar role
* Deep expertise in CRM and CPQ technologies, ideally across platforms like Salesforce, ServiceNow, SAP, Oracle, Adobe, or Shopify
* Strong technical understanding of APIs, middleware, cloud-native architecture, and web technologies (JavaScript, JSON)
* Proven experience conducting technical discovery sessions and designing customer-focused solutions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills across technical and business audiences
* Strong collaboration skills, with experience working cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams
* Ability to think strategically and operate independently in a fast-paced, remote-first environment
* Confidence and experience in engaging executive-level stakeholders and influencing strategic decisions
* ServiceNow or other relevant cloud platform certifications are a plus
* Experience within industry verticals such as manufacturing, telecommunications, or technology
* Travel Requirements: Up to 25% travel for client meetings, workshops, and events
* Language Requirements: English ans Swedish fluency required


 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
