title: Mainframe Developer
description:
**Job Description:-**




 Driving the architectural description for MQ distritbuted to Kafka. Architectural work might also include project related to Sterling (file transfer), Kafka cloud / multiregion as well as various API platforms. There integration platform specialist is preferred.
 



 Time frame, now until May next year;
 



 Key competencies have changed to:
 



 Core Technical Requirements
 



 1. Integration Architecture Expertise
 



 Proven experience designing and implementing enterprise integration solutions.
 



 Deep understanding of integration patterns (e.g., pub/sub, request/reply, event-driven architecture).
 



 Familiarity with hybrid cloud/on-premise integration strategies.
 



 2. Kafka (Event Streaming Platform)
 



 Strong knowledge of Apache Kafka architecture, including producers, consumers, topics, partitions, and brokers.
 



 Experience with Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, and schema registry.
 



 Understanding of high-throughput, low-latency messaging systems and data pipelines.
 



 3. API Platforms (Apigee, Broadcom Layer7)
 



 Experience designing and managing APIs using Apigee and/or Broadcom Layer7.
 



 Knowledge of API lifecycle management, security (OAuth2, JWT), throttling, caching, and analytics.
 



 Familiarity with OpenAPI/Swagger specifications.
 



 Or similar compared as before mentioned platforms/products.
 



 4. IBM MQ & Message Broker
 



 Expertise in IBM MQ (distributed) setup, configuration, and troubleshooting.
 



 Experience with IBM Integration Bus (IIB) or App Connect Enterprise (ACE) / Mulesoft or similar.
 



 Ability to design message flows, transformations, and routing logic.
 



 Soft Skills & Leadership
 



 Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
 



 Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
 



 Experience working in agile environments and cross-functional teams.
 



 Mentoring and guiding development teams on integration best practices.

title: SAP FICO Consultant with Group Reporting - Sweden
description:
Our client, a global healthcare company, is seeking an SAP FICO Functional Consultant with SAP S/4HANA and Group Reporting Expertise to spearhead a large-scale SAP implementation, roll-out, and maintenance projects. The selected candidate will lead the design, configuration and implementation of end-to-end solutions in the Financial Accounting (FI) and Controlling (CO) modules within the SAP S/4HANA environment, focusing on Group Reporting functionality. The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of finance and accounting business processes, a proven track record in delivering S/4HANA finance solutions and hands-on experience in SAP Group Reporting for consolidations.
   

  

  




**Job Description:**
* Solution Design & Configuration: Lead the design, configuration, and implementation of SAP FICO modules (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, and Controlling) within an S/4HANA landscape
* Business Process Consulting: Work closely with business stakeholders to understand finance and accounting requirements and translate them into SAP solutions that align with industry best practices
* S/4HANA Integration: Ensure seamless integration between S/4HANA Finance and other SAP modules (e.g., MM, SD, PP) and external systems to support end-to-end business processes
* Group Reporting: Lead the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Group Reporting for financial consolidation and reporting, ensuring accurate consolidation processes and financial statements
* Data Migration: Lead data migration activities from legacy systems to S/4HANA, including data mapping, cleansing, and validation, particularly focusing on financial data
* Testing & Validation: Lead the preparation and execution of unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT) for FICO configurations and Group Reporting
* Post Go-Live Support: Provide post-implementation support for SAP FICO and Group Reporting, troubleshooting issues, managing changes, and delivering continuous improvements
* Documentation & Training: Develop detailed functional specifications, training materials, and system documentation. Provide end-user training and knowledge transfer to ensure successful adoption
* Financial Close Optimization: Implement and enhance solutions that support financial close processes, ensuring efficiency, transparency, and accuracy in reporting
* Compliance & Reporting: Ensure that financial processes comply with regulatory requirements (e.g., IFRS, GAAP) and provide accurate and timely reports
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, project managers, and technical consultants to ensure smooth project delivery


 Requirements
   

  

* A bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, information technology, or a related field
* Minimum of 7 years of hands-on experience in SAP FICO
* In-depth experience with SAP S/4HANA Finance, including New General Ledger (New GL), Profitability Analysis (CO-PA), and Universal Journal
* Extensive experience in implementing SAP S/4HANA Group Reporting for financial consolidation, including configuration of group structures, elimination processes, and consolidated financial statements.
* Expertise in Financial Accounting (GL, AP, AR, AA) and Controlling (Cost Center Accounting, Internal Orders, Profit Center Accounting, Product Costing) modules
* Strong understanding of finance and accounting principles, particularly in areas of financial consolidation, intercompany transactions, and group accounting
* Experience in data migration processes using SAP Migration Cockpit, LSMW, or other data transfer tools
* SAP S/4HANA Finance certification is highly preferred. Additional certifications in SAP FICO or Group Reporting are a plus



 Preferred Skills:
   




* Knowledge of SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and its integration with S/4HANA for advanced financial planning and reporting
* Familiarity with IFRS 16, IFRS 9, and other relevant accounting standards
* Experience with SAP Central Finance (CFIN) implementation
* Previous Healthcare and Pharmaceutical experience is a plus
* Experience in SAP Activate methodology and Agile project management frameworks

title: Test framework Design Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you passionate about shaping next-generation continuous integration test automation framework? Do you thrive in fast-paced, innovative environments and want to lead transformational change in telecom test automation?
   

  

 As the Test Framework Design Architect, you will lead the design and development of an extraordinary CI flow and test automation framework. You will play a pivotal role in elevating our solution’s CI capabilities, introducing new ways of working, and driving automation, digitalisation, and collaboration across a geographically diverse, matrix organisation.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 You will collaborate closely with multiple teams, including Test Architects and the Architecture & Technology units. In this role, you will foster collaboration across various functions, ensuring seamless integration and cooperation.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Managing the architecture, development and implementation of our Robot based test automation framework.
* Providing technical mentorship that will cultivate a culture of excellence, continuous learning, and growth, empowering the automation teams.


**The skills you bring:**
 You combine strong technical expertise with the ability to collaborate, innovate, and adapt in a fast-changing environment. You thrive on solving complex problems, driving automation, and inspiring teams to work smarter together.
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in development and testing roles
* Experience as a technical lead along with proven experience in framework/software design, development, and architecture
* Strong knowledge of DevOps principles, CI/CD pipelines, and tools (Git/Gerrit, Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub)
* Proficiency in Python programming
* Hands-on experience with containerisation and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
* Understanding of cloud-native architecture, microservices, and open-source practices
* Domain knowledge of Ericsson 5G Core architecture: Protocols, and components.
* Innovative mindset with strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills across diverse teams
* Interest or experience in applying AI/ML within automation frameworks


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Senior Software Engineer - Play & Control
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for an experienced backend engineer with a strong background in functional programming, for our Play & Control team.
   

  

 You will play a key part in evolving and deploying our next-generation playback system, the backbone that ensures music plays seamlessly across platforms, devices, and integrations.
   

  

 The team owns the playback experience across all of our platforms. We make the music flow, from the cloud to speakers, through our apps and partner integrations. Our technology powers playback for mobile and desktop clients, our own hardware, and various connected devices through SDKs and APIs. Everyone in the team works across the stack, to ensure a smooth and stable music experience everywhere.
   

  

 You will be joining at an exciting time, our new playback architecture is being rolled out, and you’ll play a central role in shaping how it operates across all platforms.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Design, build, and refine backend services that power music playback across diverse clients and environments
* Contribute to the rollout of our next-generation playback control architecture
* Collaborate with our partners (e.g., Sonos and other integrations)
* Develop our cloud-based audio streaming platform
* Ensure scalability, reliability, and performance in a distributed environment
* Influence a technical direction for systems written in Scala, Go, Rust, and C++


**About You**
 Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ year of professional experience
* Solid experience with functional programming principles (preferably with Scala)
* Ability to design and implement scalable, cloud-native applications
* Professional experience with one or more of the following: Scala, Go, Rust, C++
* Experience deploying and managing applications in Kubernetes (preferably on Google Cloud, but not the main focus)
* A minset to care about deployment, monitoring, and operational stability of your services


**Beneficial**
* Experience in audio streaming, IoT, or hardware-integrated products
* Interest in music technology and playback systems


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Oskar Thorin at oskar@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Konsultchef inom bank, finans och ekonomi
description:
Har du erfarenhet från konsultbranschen och ett starkt konsultnätverk inom bank och finans? Vill du jobba i ett företag med starkt varumärke? Vill du vara med och utveckla och utvecklas? Då är kanske rollen som senior Konsultchef på Sharp Recruitment & Consultants något för dig.
 



  





**Om Sharp Recruitment & Consultants** 




 Vi är en av Sveriges ledande specialister inom juridik, compliance, finans och ekonomi. Sedan starten 2014 har vi byggt långsiktiga samarbeten med några av Nordens främsta företag – från banker och kapitalförvaltare till tech- och energibolag. Vår kultur präglas av kvalitet, engagemang och professionalism. Vi kombinerar affärsmässighet med genuint intresse för människor och utveckling.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Hos Sharp Recruitment & Consultants blir du en del av ett nischat och högt specialiserat och presterande team som arbetar med Sveriges ledande företag inom bank, finans, ekonomi, säkerhet, risk och compliance.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder dig:
 


* En senior och självständig roll med stort ansvar
* Etablerat varumärke och kundnätverk
* Korta beslutsvägar och mycket utvecklat och bra säljteam
* Kontor i centrala Stockholm med möjlighet till hybridarbete



  





 Hos oss får du arbeta i ett bolag som kombinerar entreprenörsanda och professionalism där vi ständigt utvecklar vårt erbjudande och våra relationer med marknadens främsta specialister.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Konsultchef ansvarar du för hela konsultflödet, från rekrytering och kundkontakt och matchning till ledarskap och uppföljning. Du arbetar nära våra partners och säljteam för att säkra kvalitet, effektivitet och leverans i varje uppdrag.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
 


* Rekrytera, leda och coacha både anställda och underkonsulter
* Säkerställa snabba och träffsäkra konsultpresentationer
* Vara huvudkontakt för konsulter under uppdrag
* Bidra till struktur, kvalitet och effektivitet i verksamheten



  





**Om dig** 




 Du har arbetslivserfarenhet från konsultbranschen och ett starkt nätverk inom bank, finans eller ekonomi. Du är en relationsdriven ledare som kombinerar affärssinne med struktur och kvalitetstänk.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Minst tre års erfarenhet från konsultbranschen
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med roller inom finans, ekonomi, compliance, risk eller säkerhet
* Akademisk examen inom ekonomi eller finans
* Förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer och skapa resultat



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vill du vara med och utveckla vår konsultverksamhet inom bank, finans och ekonomi? Välkommen med din ansökan – urval sker löpande. För frågor om verksamheten kontakta Zarina Virsholm på zarina.virsholm@sharprecruitment.se.

title: Experienced professionals to our SAP Finance team (Stockholm)
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 Deloitte is looking for talented and experienced professionals to join our SAP-team in Sweden. As a market leader, we work with both global and local organizations on complex transformations, including major business-driven IT changes. With approximately 25,000 SAP experts in over 135 countries, Deloitte is among SAP’s most valued strategic partners. This is why SAP has placed Deloitte within the highest strategic alliance partner category, and why we have been recognized as the Global Leader in SAP Services by leading consultancies and analysts such as Forrester and Gartner.
   

  

  





 We are looking for
 **senior SAP Finance professionals** 
 who have an appetite for delivering sustainable, business-driven projects and being excited to co-operate with the largest companies and well-known brands. You enjoy engaging with clients to understand their requirements and find solution options for key challenges in finance area providing subject matter expertise with a good awareness of SAP and associated technologies within the process area.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Your most important attributes we’d like to see are:
   

  

  




* Thorough expertise in finance related SAP S/4HANA areas/competences such as Central Finance, FI/CO, Margin & Profitability Analysis, Project accounting with PS, Product Costing, Master Data modelling, Understanding of end to end process like Order to Cash, Procure to Pay or other
* Good understanding of SAP S/4HANA product roadmap (experience of other related SAP solutions such as e.g. Group Reporting, SAC is advantageous but not required) and knowledge of relevant delivery methods for SAP (waterfall, hybrid agile, agile) preferably with deployment experience e.g. global template rollouts
* Great addition (but not must) if the candidate has a high level understanding of the SAP cloud offerings -RISE and GROW


 Additionally, to ensure smooth start and succeeding in the role, it is required from the applicant to:
   

  

  

* Hold a master’s degree or similar relevant educational background with years of relevant SAP experience - preferably across multiple industries. Broad SAP functional and technical expertise in your own process area with a good understanding of integrations between SAP modules and other applications
* Have previous consulting, project delivery and sales/pre-sales experience working with multiple large clients both with business and IT stakeholders
* Be fluent in both written and spoken English with excellent communication and presentation skills, and an ability to conceptualize and communicate complex topics in a clear and understandable manner. Proficiency in Swedish language seen as a strong advantage.


**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
   

  

  

  

 Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
   

  

  

  

**How to apply**




 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.
   

  

  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with To Find Out.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*
  

  

  

**Questions?**




 If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Anna Taube, Manager Talent Acquisition at ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit
 
 www.deloitte.se
   

  

  






**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: People Partner
description:
**IGNITE THE GROWTH OF B2B SUBSCRIPTION LEADERS** 




 Subscription-based models are transforming B2B businesses—unlocking scalable growth, predictable revenue, and deeper client engagement. Yet as these businesses evolve, many struggle to scale efficiently. That’s where Younium comes in. We built a powerful cloud platform tailored to the advanced needs of B2B subscriptions, enabling businesses to handle complex subscriptions, streamline financial operations, and enhance their reporting capabilities.
 



  





**We are Younium!** 




 Gone are the startup days: We are now in full growth mode. You’ll thrive in a high-energy, creative, and transparent environment fueled by collaboration. With hubs in Amsterdam, Kraków, Stockholm, Malmö, and Philadelphia, plus remote contributors, we’re building a truly global team.
 



  





 Curious to help businesses master their subscription economies? Come join us.
 



  





**What you will do:** 



* Source candidates, organize, and lead the full recruitment processes.
* Ensure we maintain a high standard of candidate experience.
* Improve our internal P&C processes, tools & way of working.
* Supporting the organization in HR matters. You'll support both employees and managers daily.
* Lead and execute on P&C initiatives.



  





**Who are you?** 




 You thrive when you roll up your sleeves and deliver. With an entrepreneurial spirit and a business-savvy mindset, you see opportunities rather than obstacles.
 



  





 Our current Head of People & Culture will begin parental leave, and you’ll take on the HR responsibilities in her absence. In this HR role, you’ll own everything from hiring top talent to shaping and delivering on the company's people strategy and culture.
 



  





 You believe Employer Branding and candidate experience matter - you know how they drive outcomes like attraction and retention. Every day will bring something different. You’ll get to build, influence, and implement the people agenda with freedom and purpose - and you’ll enjoy it.
 



  





 You hold yourself accountable. You take ownership of your work, meet commitments, and stay curious.
 



  





 You engage with people and you communicate clearly - with candidates, colleagues, and leaders. Your ability to connect, listen, and express ideas matters at every level.
 



  





**Must have:** 



* 3-5 years of experience managing the
 *full recruitment cycle* 
 in a fast-paced environment, preferably in an IT/SaaS company. Recruiting for one or several of these roles is a must: B2B/Tech Sales and Marketing, Developers, Customer Relations/Customer Success, and Specialist roles within product management.
* Degree in Business Administration, HRM, or another relevant field.
* Previous experience in supporting managers in an HR Business Partner role (or similar).
* A good understanding of HR metrics and analytics (Retention, time to hire, eNPS, cNPS, etc.)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (bonus if you speak Dutch or German).



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience in a role where Performance Management was part of your responsibilities (for example, feedback, performance reviews, L&D, etc).
* A good understanding of finance, payroll, and legal.
* Skills in various sourcing methodologies (i.e, LinkedIn Recruiter)
* Experiences in social selling, i.e, for Recruitment and Employer Branding purposes.
* Experience in tools like Teamtailor, HaileyHR, and Alva Labs.



  





**The Younium team spirit** 



* 70+ passionate team members across Stockholm, Malmö, Kraków, Amsterdam, Philadelphia, and remote
* A tight-knit culture blending agility, transparency, and substantial ownership and accountability, balanced by collaboration across the board
* Growth mindset: continuous learning and development, internal mobility, and inclusion at our core. We embrace an attitude of constant willingness to improve, not comfort.
* You’ll be part of a performance-first team where self‑starters thrive
* True work-life harmony: remote-friendly setup, flexible hours, and boundaries you can trust
* Above all, we believe in having fun together, both on and off the clock!



  





*📆 ⏰ The preferred starting date for this position is ASAP.* 




  





*📍 Please note that we do not offer any relocation package, nor will we recruit outside the EU for this position. This role will be based in Stockholm with a hybrid remote setup.*

title: Senior Go Backend Engineer - Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced Software Engineer join our Go initative within the Merchant Group at Wolt! If you have a strong track record of building and maintaining scalable, production-grade systems you like to drive impact at scale and mentor juniors and peers - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The Merchant Group consists of 150+ engineers across 25+ cross-functional teams, working together to help merchants grow their businesses and streamline operations through innovative technology. Some of us focus on building seamless experiences for our merchants, while others work on the behind-the-scenes magic that makes everything run smoothly.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a senior engineer in our group, you’ll work your magic in Go (and some Kotlin) helping shape how merchants succeed with Wolt. You’ll have opportunities to:
   

  

* Design, build, and scale reliable systems that power merchant experiences.
* Work across the full development lifecycle – from business logic and testing to cloud infrastructure and data streaming.
* Collaborate on architecture and technology choices that keep our systems simple, scalable, and efficient.
* Grow your skills and knowledge by working alongside experienced teammates in an environment that values learning and experimentation.


 How We Work
   

  

* Autonomy & Ownership – Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
* Collaboration – Architecture and working methods are defined together, ensuring we make the best choices for long-term success.
* Scalability & Simplicity – We value pragmatic solutions that keep our systems robust without unnecessary complexity. We use technologies that serve Wolt, our teams, and our engineers best. You’ll have the freedom to experiment and adopt the tools that work.


 Our Tech Stack
   

  

 Our core technologies include Go, as well as Kotlin (Ktor, Koin, Spring, gRPC), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes.
   

  

 Why Join Us?
   

  

 Wolt is a place where you can learn, teach, and grow. If you’re passionate about building great technology and working in an environment that values teamwork and autonomy, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 📍This open role are based in our tech hubs in Helsinki or Stockholm. We work in distributed teams, but might not be able to offer fully remote work or relocation.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We’re seeking an experienced Software Engineer, so we expect that you:
   

  

* Not only understand customer problems but can break them down into actionable steps for both yourself and the team. You balance short-term needs with long-term goals, creating high-quality, scalable solutions.
* Lead by example, setting high standards for work quality and managing projects effectively, even in uncertain situations. You take full ownership of your team’s work, making improvements that benefit both customers and colleagues. You regularly spot gaps and provide valuable recommendations to cross-functional partners.
* Are used to being a role model and informal leader, collaborating with partner teams and mentoring both juniors and peers.
* Are an excellent communicator, being succint and to the point.


 Next steps
   

  

 We are continuously reviewing applications, so don’t hesitate to apply today - you will hear back from us as soon as possible.
   

  

 You can read more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Software test engineer
description:
Job description
  
  

The System Test Engineer and Integration Engineer will work with test and verification of automotive applications. The role of the System Test and Integration Engineer is to ensure that our products are compliant to applicable requirements and to assure delivery of safe, reliable and stable products to our customers. System Tests, System Integration, Test Planning, Field support, verification and fault-analysis of our products is within the work scope.
  
  

**In your role you will:**  

* Prepare Test Plans to verify and ensure that system meets its design specifications and requirements within the project.
* Write Test Specification, Test Environment Specification, Test Record, Test Reports within a project
* Develop and execute test cases and related scripts for scenario-based testing in lab environment.
* Analysis of test results, reporting deviations from expected system behavior
* Support lab configuration setup according to technical specifications
* Plan, coordinate and support of System Integration activities
* Support Project Management, Project Engineering and System Engineering
* Re-create, analyze and suggest potential solutions of reported error reports
* Participate in field and integration tests if required
* Participate and support in system integrations in vehicles if required
* Communicate within the organization and customers
* •Participates in technical document reviews and prepare documents for submission to the customers and suppliers;
* Document results of executed test cases
* Be responsible for documents such as Test Specification, Test Environment Specification and Test Record


Your profile
  
* Bachelor of Engineering degree or equivalent work experience in development projects

title: Electro-mechanical Engineer
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0083526
**Date Posted:**

2025-11-11
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**Do you want to enable the green energy transition, and together with colleagues meet the world’s needs for sustainable, flexible and secure energy?  

  



In your work you will be part of HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) business unit that is a part of Hitachi Energy’s division and is located in Ludvika. The unit develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. Hitachi Energy’s developed HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables, thus enabling stability cooperation between grids, sea-based wind power and more.  

  



Are you interested in combining high voltage topics with common sense, performing electro-mechanical studies as well as maintaining an overall plant perspective in large scale projects, all in a highly international environment? Then maybe you should consider becoming part of our team at HVDC!


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Perform studies and Finite Element simulations during tenders and project execution. You will be working on multidisciplinary technical aspects such as insulation, electro-thermal, electric- and magnetic fields and grounding to mention some.
* Support HVDC plant designers with multi-physics expertise in a design where current is in kA, power in GW and voltages are in the hundreds of kV.
* Be part of R&D activities to make sure we stay competitive also for the future.
* Most of the work will involve performing various studies at the office in Ludvika but since site measurements and verification inspections are included international travel is also part of the teams scope.
* In this role you will have a lot of opportunities to explore various technical fields exploring Multiphysics.

**Your background**

* We are looking for a Master of Science degree in an electrical field, applied physics, power systems or similar.
* Experienced professionals or fresh out of university – we are interested in all kinds of people as we are hiring for multiple positions.
* You have a keen interest in or understanding of mechanical aspects in order to combine Amps, Volts and Newton in your design.
* Experience in COMSOL or similar 3D simulation software is a merit
* Prior experience in any of the technical areas is beneficial but not a demand, your personality and interest are of high importance.
* As a person you are a positive, problem-solving individual with the attitude that everything is possible to do in a team. You will work in a team where being able to take responsibility and willingness to learn are key features.
* A general interest in technology is needed to be a good fit for this position. The goal is to have cost-effective solutions while fulfilling all requirements why common sense and understanding of practical aspects is beneficial.
* You should ideally like working in a multicultural environment and be able to express yourself written and spoken in English.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply now! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


This position is based in Ludvika or Västerås


Recruiting Manager daniel.holback@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. title: Lead Test Engineer – Cross Product Co-ordination
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU’LL DO**


We are looking for a highly skilled **E2E Test Lead** to drive quality across complex, integrated enterprise systems. In this role, you will lead a cross-product coordination team, define and implement testing strategies, and ensure end-to-end quality is embedded throughout the delivery lifecycle. You will work closely with engineering managers, solution architects, and multiple delivery teams to align testing efforts with business and technical goals.


At H&M, one of our core principles is “**We are One Team**” In this role, you will collaborate closely with global colleagues, including partners in Sweden, to ensure alignment and successful delivery of high-quality solutions.


In addition to this you will...

* Lead and motivate Cross Product Co-ordination team, set priorities, and make technical strategic decisions.
* Support with resource planning for the initiatives.
* Collaborate along with engineering manager in achieving the cross-product co-ordinator’s team goals.
* Collaborate with solution architects and development teams to ensure test strategies align with architectural goals.
* Implement KPI’s to understand and improve the effectiveness of testing.
* Define, implement, and improve the way of working for test coordination.
* Work with stakeholders to define and resolve the test environment, data needs, and dependencies.
* Identify risk, develop mitigation and escalate when required
* Support the team identify test scope, objectives and key business processes to be validated
* Support with enabling the automation of E2E test flows where applicable.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to the Cross Product Co-ordinator’s team on best practices in test automation and architecture.

**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**

At H&M Group, you’ll be part of the **Delivery Assurance team** within Customer Online Operations area—a global, cross-functional team dedicated to enabling data-driven decision-making at the core of our customer offering.


We empower our cross functional teams to deliver seamless shopping experience to our customer by providing integrated quality, stable rollout process & data driven insights.


We value continuous improvement, strong engineering practices, and a shared commitment to H&M’s success.

**WHO YOU ARE**


We are looking for people with

* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field or significant, equivalent work experience.
* Experience working with **Agile teams** and associated tools (Scrum, Jira, Confluence, QMetry).
* Solid experience **testing** across **APIs, microservices, web, mobile**, and **backend system**s; familiarity with message queues, data flows, and integration patterns.
* Strong understanding of **E2E test** strategies, planning, execution, and reporting across complex, integrated systems.
* Experience coordinating test environments, managing test data strategies, and resolving environment dependencies in multi-team setups.
* Ability to define and **track test metrics** and quality KPIs to measure effectiveness and drive improvements.
* Knowledge of test automation and familiarity with the retail domain is nice to have.


And People who are….

* Analytical and strong problem-solvers, capable of diagnosing issues and proposing effective solutions.
* Professionals who are excellent communicators, able to clearly present testing strategies, risks, and progress to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Proactive and analytical thinker, identifying issues early, assessing impact, and escalating effectively when needed.
* Team players who can influence without direct authority, build consensus, and drive alignment across diverse teams.

**WHO WE ARE**


H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**


At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.

* **Staff discount card**: Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* **H&M Incentive Program (HIP)**: Included in our HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* **Competitive pensions**: Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* **Generous vacation**: 30 days' vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* **Additional perks**: Discounts from Benify.
* **Innovative Environment**: Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* **Global Impact**: Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* **Professional Growth**: Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* **Collaborative Culture**: Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.

**JOIN US**


Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.


Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.
