title: Mechanical Engineer - Nodes
description:
### **Welcome to PXGEO**


PXGEO is an innovative marine geophysical service provider combining the strengths of ocean bottom and towed streamer seismic data acquisition techniques to deliver seamless subsurface imaging for a sustainable future.

### **What's the role?**


This role will be part of our Manta Technology team and will be instrumental in designing, developing, and optimizing mechanical systems for our advanced subsea nodes. These nodes are critical components in supporting today’s high-performance data acquisition methods, where ultra-long endurance and reliability are the hallmarks of Manta’s product line. Key responsibilities include:

* Design and analyze mechanical components for subsea nodes, ensuring robustness, reliability, and manufacturability.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with electrical, software, and systems engineers to integrate mechanical designs into complete node systems.
* Conduct simulations and testing to validate mechanical performance under extreme underwater conditions.
* Support prototyping and field trials, including hands-on assembly and troubleshooting.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of node design for enhanced durability, ease of deployment, and cost-efficiency.
* Help to facilitate and support the transition between design, manufacturing and support
* Document designs and processes in accordance with industry standards and internal quality systems.

### **Who are we looking for?**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field
* 3+ years of experience in mechanical design, preferably in marine, aerospace or automotive
* Experience with SolidWorks and SolidWorks PDM and participation in the full product lifecycle.
* Familiarity with subsea systems, pressure vessels, risk analysis and design to cost, quality and for manufacturability is a plus
* Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset
* Fluent in both written and spoken English

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**Kickstart Your Career as a Software Test Engineer at Ascom!**


Are you at the beginning of your career and passionate about quality assurance and testing embedded software? Do you want to be part of a global team that makes a difference every day? Then we have the perfect opportunity for you!


*This position is to our Swedish site with placement in* ***Gothenburg****.*


**About Us**: At Ascom, we are proud of what we do, knowing that we are making a difference. You will work in a stimulating and diverse environment where you can use your skills in a way that suits you best. As a knowledge-driven organization, it is important for us that our experts share their expertise and help colleagues grow. We offer an open and international environment where personal initiative is both expected and appreciated.


**What You Will Do:**


* Design and implement manual test cases based on requirements.
* Execute manual and automated tests and analyze any failures. Troubleshooting.
* Install and configure test systems in our lab.
* Participate in reviews of requirements and test cases.
* Collaborate with colleagues and partners in Ascom’s global organization.

**What We Are Looking For:**

* Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Electrical Engineering, IT, or Computer Science.
* Beginning of your testing career but a few years of experience in software testing is beneficial.
* Familiarity with standard test processes for software verification (ISTQB Foundation or similar).
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
* Experience in test automation with Python or similar.
* Experience with agile testing methods.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills

**Personal Skills**: We believe you are a responsible problem solver with a sense of ownership and a willingness to learn new technologies. You have a passion for software testing and feel comfortable working with other test engineers and developers to ensure systems are designed for reliability, performance, and quality. You pay attention to detail and are quality-conscious because our products are often used in hospitals or enterprises. If you dare and care to do your very best and make a real difference in your work, you are probably one of us.


**Why Ascom?** Within Ascom Global R&D, you are an important contributor with broad responsibilities and good opportunities to grow in your role. Our culture is reflected by the Ascom Way and its six principles: Customer Focus, Commitment & Accountability, Growth, Innovation, Leadership, we are Ascom. Ascom is a company where you will be able to engage with all parts of the value stream, from development to sales, manufacturing, and service delivery. If you are motivated by making a real difference in your work, you are probably one of us.


**Contact and Application:** Are you interested in the job? The selection process is ongoing, so please submit your application as soon as possible through the “apply” button
company_description: Ascom is a global solutions provider focused on Healthcare Information and Communication Technology (ICT) and mobile workflow solutions.

title: Frontend Developer with focus on UX/UI
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we're building cutting-edge gaming products that redefine how players experience online entertainment. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with a strong UX/UI focus, or a UX/UI Designer with frontend development chops, to join one of our expanding engineering teams.
 



  





 You'll play a key role in shaping the look, feel, and interactivity of products that reach a global audience—contributing not only to how things work but also how they feel. At Evolution, design and development are not siloed; you'll be an essential part of product decisions from day one, working in highly collaborative, autonomous teams.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Design and build intuitive, responsive, and beautiful interfaces with React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Bring UX and UI designs to life—from wireframes to pixel-perfect implementation.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and engineers to craft seamless user experiences.
* Own the frontend from concept to production, including performance optimization, accessibility, and maintainability.
* Contribute to our design system and help shape a consistent visual language across products.
* Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve based on real user feedback and data.
* Be part of a team that values learning through iteration, experimentation, and shared responsibility.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have solid experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS techniques.
* Possess a keen eye for design details, and care deeply about creating delightful user experiences.
* Enjoy bridging the gap between design and development.
* Are comfortable building advanced components.
* Believe in clean, maintainable code and smooth user flows.
* Have good communication skills in English and love working in a collaborative environment.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Understanding of accessibility and web performance best practices.
* Familiarity with UI/UX testing tools or user research methods.
* An interest in gaming or digital entertainment interfaces.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 We care more about your potential than checking every box. If you're excited about building exceptional interfaces and love working in small, empowered teams, we want to hear from you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies and help us craft experiences that players around the world love.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



  





 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



  





 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Frontend
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Angular (Nuvarande lösningar är byggd i Angular men erfarenheten kan även vara i React/Svelte/Vue)
* Nx
* Typescript
* DevOps - gärna lite kunskap kring pipelines, CI/CD
* CSS/SCSS
* GitOps (bonus)
* Erfarenhet av designbibliotek
* Bonus med erfarenhet av Stencil
* Senior som arbetat i flera år


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 18-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
We are looking for a ServiceNow CSDM Developer to join our CMDB team and the design and enhancement of our Common Service Data Model (CSDM) and CMDB.
 



  





 Responsibilities:
 



 • Develop and implement CSDM-aligned CMDB structures and relationships.
 



 • Configure and manage Application Services, Business Applications, and Service Offerings.
 



 • Support Discovery, Service Mapping, and integrations across other servicenow modules and discovery tool like ITOM and BMC Remedy.
 



 • Develop scripts, workflows, and dashboards to improve data quality and automation.
 



 • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive service visibility and data governance.
 



  





 Requirements:
 



  





 • 5+ years of hands-on experience with ServiceNow CMDB and CSDM (v3.0 or later).
 



 • Strong skills in JavaScript, Glide API, and ServiceNow configuration.
 



 • Solid understanding of ITIL v4 and ServiceNow platform architecture.
 



 • Experience in data modeling, CI class design, and CMDB health improvements.
 



 • Excellent communication and documentation skills ,able to explain complex models in simple terms
 



 • ServiceNow certifications (CIS–CMDB, CIS–Discovery, CSA) preferred.

title: Backend Engineer - Business systems expert
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for a
 **Backend Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Revenue Engineering** 
 team.
   

  

 The team is responsible for our core backend, subscription management and integrations to business support systems. You’ll work on a wide range of projects — from distributed systems and data pipelines to integrations with finance and CRM systems — in close collaboration with web developers, designers and business stakeholders.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design and develop backend services needed to realise our product roadmap
* Improve, evolve and replace existing services and APIs
* Ensure our systems remain performant, reliable and cost efficient
* Collaborate with finance and operations teams to translate requirements into technical solutions
* Help the team grow by sharing knowledge and lifting each other up


**About You**
 We believe that great engineers come from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

 You're someone who thrives in a collaborative environment, enjoying the process of solving problems as part of a team. With a curious and open mindset, you're always eager to learn, explore new ideas, and embrace challenges.
   

  

 You know how to prioritise and adapt in a fast-moving setting while keeping sight of the bigger picture. Open communication is important to you, and you feel comfortable both giving and receiving constructive feedback in a supportive and respectful way.
   

  

 You’re a backend engineer who enjoys bridging product, data and business systems. You take pride in writing reliable code, but also in understanding how your work impacts billing, reporting and real customers.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 3+ years of experience building backend services with Go and/or Scala, working with GraphQL and REST, and shipping data to or working with BigQuery
* 1+ years hands-on experience with NetSuite (configuration, data mapping or integrations using REST, SuiteTalk or SuiteScript)
* 1+ years of stakeholder collaboration with finance teams (internal ERP users) and operations/RevOps teams (internal CRM users)


**Beneficial Requirements**
* Experience integrating systems like Shopify, Adyen or other similar platforms
* Background in ERP or business systems development (as a consultant or internal developer)
* Interest in financial systems, billing, and subscription management
* Experience working in an international SaaS company


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
 Många års erfarenhet och en dokumenterad framgång inom utveckling, modernisering och underhåll av CI/CD- och DevOps-processer samt automatisering i stora mjukvaruutvecklingsorganisationer.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av utveckling av inbyggd programvara (embedded SW) är ett krav.
   

  

 Personen bör vara mycket driven och ha starka kommunikationsförmågor, vara kundorienterad och aktivt söka upp relevanta intressenter för att ta fram lösningar som har en tydligt positiv påverkan på både effektiviteten i våra processer och kvaliteten på våra produkter.
   

  

 Stark DevOps- och CI/CD-kompetens inom relevanta teknologier och verktyg såsom Git, Jenkins, Python, Groovy, Docker, Bash, Kubernetes, Linux med flera.
   

  

 Svenska flytande i tal och skrift
   

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 18-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: iOS Tech Lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* A seasoned iOS engineer (10+ years) with deep expertise in Swift, UIKit, SwiftUI, and modern concurrency.
* Proven experience leading technical direction or architectural initiatives for large-scale consumer apps.
* Strong grasp of software design principles, dependency injection, and modular architecture.
* Skilled in refactoring and modernizing complex codebases.
* Passionate about code quality, testing, and automation (unit, UI, and snapshot tests).
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD systems (Fastlane, Xcode Cloud, Codemagic, or GitHub Actions).
* Excellent communicator and mentor who uplifts teammates and builds technical alignment across teams.
* Proactive, forward-thinking, and driven to continuously improve app performance, reliability, and developer experience.
* Experience with Firebase, MapKit, StoreKit, or large-scale mobile data architecture.


**Application deadline:** 
 18-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Engine Systems & Tools Designer
description:
Are you passionate about designing the systems and tools that power game creation?
   

  

 Do you enjoy shaping workflows that make development smoother and more intuitive for artists, programmers, and designers?
   

  

 Join our Engine & Tools team as an
 **Engine Systems & Tools Designer** 
 , and help us bridge the gap between the engine development team and our users.
   

  

 At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.
   

  

**What You’ll Do..**
 As an
 **Engine Systems & Tools Designer** 
 , you’ll design and improve systems, tools, and workflows that support developers across multiple projects. You’ll work closely with programmers, technical leads, and other disciplines to ensure that our internal tools are intuitive, scalable, and tailored for building our Grand Strategy Games. Your work will directly impact how efficiently our teams create content and build our games.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design workflows, tools, and systems for content creation within the Engine & Tools team.
* Act as a central contact for understanding and shaping tools and requirements within the engine development team.
* Collaborate with programmers and stakeholders to ensure that tools align with both technical feasibility and creative needs.
* Influence tool development based on current usage, priorities, and long-term goals.
* Identify opportunities for shared technology and cross-project workflows.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ Years experience in UX or workflow design—preferably within game development tools and workflows.
* Strong understanding of the needs of technical and creative users (artists, designers, programmers).
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, or other flowcharting software.
* Familiarity with game development engines and tools (Unreal, Unity, or proprietary equivalents).
* Good interpersonal skills for working closely with programmers and other disciplines.
* Comfortable communicating in English, both written and spoken.


 Good to have skills
   

  

* Experience in C++ and Python to easier communicate with our programmers.


 Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.
   

  

 If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Engine & Tools team!

title: Senior Android Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Android Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Design, build & scale high-performance mobile applications using Jetpack Compose.
* Collaborate and participate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features across both platforms.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organisations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.
* Drive and lead Android projects. Be able to oversee a team of Android developers, define standards, and manage team deliveries.
* Able to either work closely with, or take part in solving problems on other platforms like iOS, cross-platform and more.
* Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends to ensure our apps are cutting-edge.
* Having a deep understanding of the mobile deployment pipeline.


**Who You Are**
* You're an Android developer (with 10+ years of experience) and a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognising the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Release Train Engineer of Software Factory Runway VCT
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**About The VCT**
 The Software Factory Runway VCT is a value creation flow that is responsible for developing and operating tooling used in embedded development. The VCT is managing 13 teams and 140 people. Line organisations that contribute to the flow are: multiple departments within TRATON R&D (Södertälje and Munich), Scania IT and MAN Engineering Hub in Lisbon.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
 In the Role of Release Train Engineer (RTE), you will be a key member of the triad leading the VCT Software Factory Runway, collaborating with global and local stakeholders. Our key stakeholders are our global embedded development community, which we serve with embedded development tooling, both TRATON R&D and BID. You will be responsible for driving the throughput and predictability of the VCT by:
   

  

  

* Challenging the status quo constantly and not being afraid to experiment and fail.
* Designing, planning and executing the necessary ceremonies within our VCT.
* Be a servant leader for the scrum masters of your VCT, developing the way of working together with them.
* Be an active leader in the triad and management team, contribute to a collaborative, fun and ambitious team.
* Manage the communication of the VCT towards different internal and external stakeholders.
* Cooperate with the rest of the VCF to ensure that we are delivering the right value to our customers.


**Position Details**
* This is a full-time/permanent position within the global TRATON R&D matrix organisation.
* The role offers the flexibility to be based in any of the locations where the TRATON R&D organisation operates (Germany, Sweden, USA, Brazil). The majority of the staff is in Sweden.
* You will functionally report to Maria Nygren, Manager EE Information Architecture & Toolchain (TGRESI)


**Your profile**
* You have at least 5 years of experience with Agile methodology and have leadership experience in a scaled agile context. Fluent in the use of Jira and Easy Agile. Previous experience in the role of RTE is great.
* We value a proactive mindset. You take responsibility, thrive in a dynamic, fast-growing environment, and demonstrate adaptability with a hands-on approach.
* You are a collaborative team player who values service-oriented cooperation with managers and employees and fosters a positive work environment.
* You like leadership and include it in everything you do in an active way.
* You are highly interested in understanding all brands' ways of working and cultures.
* You are proficient in written and spoken English for effective communication with a global audience; knowledge of Swedish or German is a plus.


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, but no later than December 16, 2025. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**
 Maria Nygren, Manager EE Information Architecture & Toolchain (TGRESI), maria.nygren@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application**

title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Swedish speaking)
description:
**Assignment Description:** 




 We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**What you will work on:** 



* Design and develop secure, scalable authentication, user registration, and login solutions for large-scale applications.
* Take ownership of system architecture, ensuring robust, maintainable, and efficient design across both frontend and backend.
* Lead technical discussions, provide architectural guidance, and drive best practices within the development team.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define technical requirements and deliver seamless user experiences.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of development processes, deployment pipelines, and system performance.
* Engage in hands-on coding and troubleshooting to ensure delivery quality and technical excellence.



  





**What you bring:** 



* 8+ years of experience in full stack development with deep backend expertise in Java.
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and Next.js for modern web application development.
* Solid understanding of authentication standards and protocols, including OAuth.
* Experience with containerized environments such as Kubernetes and cloud platforms like Google Cloud (GCP).
* Proven background in developing and maintaining large-scale, consumer-facing digital products.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with proactive communication and collaboration skills
* Fluent in English and Swedish.

title: Senior SAP BTP Developer (DM) - Skövde
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a Senior SAP BTP Developer to join an innovative initiative focused on MTM4 and MTM Next Gen. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with a skilled team, contribute to next-generation solutions, and mentor junior developers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain applications on SAP BTP.
* Design and implement Fiori apps and SAP UI5 interfaces.
* Apply TypeScript in the development of custom solutions.
* Provide technical guidance and mentoring to the team.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to ensure high-quality deliverables.


**Requirements:**
* Proven experience in SAP BTP development.
* Strong knowledge of Fiori and SAP UI5.
* Proficient in TypeScript.
* Experience mentoring and guiding team members


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Analytics Engineer till BROCC
description:
**Är du den vi söker?** 




*Vill du vara med och bygga en dataplattform som verkligen gör skillnad? Som Analytics Engineer hos BROCC får du en nyckelroll i att forma hur vi arbetar med data, från strategiska beslut till regelefterlevnad och affärsinsikter. Hos oss blir du den som förvandlar komplex information till användbar kunskap. Du skapar strukturer, modeller och processer som gör det möjligt för hela organisationen att fatta smartare och snabbare beslut, på en trygg, spårbar och enhetlig datagrund.* 




  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 I rollen som Analytics Engineer kombinerar du teknik, struktur och förståelse för affären och blir en viktig del i att driva vår dataplattform framåt. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden omfattar bland annat att:
 


* Designa, implementera och underhålla datamodeller i Snowflake som utgör grunden för företagets beslutsstöd.
* Utveckla tydlig och väldokumenterad transformationslogik i dbt eller Meltano.
* Säkerställa att nyckeltal används enhetligt i hela organisationen – vår ”single source of truth”.
* Bidra till en pålitlig, skalbar och modern dataplattform byggd på Snowflake, Meltano, Airflow, AWS och Kubernetes.
* Öka den datadrivna mognaden i företaget genom att stötta kollegor och sprida bästa praxis.



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som vill vara med och forma hur BROCC arbetar med data, en analytiskt lagd och tekniskt kunnig person som trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och affär.
 



 Du har en akademisk bakgrund inom exempelvis systemvetenskap, data/IT eller motsvarande område och flerårig erfarenhet av analytiskt arbete, BI-utveckling eller datateknik. Du har mycket goda kunskaper i SQL och är van vid att arbeta med både dimensionell och relationell datamodellering. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av moderna, molnbaserade datalager såsom Snowflake och att du har ett naturligt intresse för att skapa effektiva, robusta datalösningar som gör skillnad i verksamheten.
 



  





 Du trivs i nära samarbete med kollegor från olika delar av organisationen, där du fångar upp behov, översätter dem till tekniska lösningar och förklarar komplexa datakoncept på ett sätt som är begripligt och engagerande även för icke-tekniska målgrupper. Erfarenhet av dbt eller Meltano för datatransformationer samt orkestreringsverktyg som Airflow är starkt meriterande. Har du dessutom insikt i regelefterlevnad, regulatorisk rapportering eller erfarenhet från fintech, bank eller andra reglerade branscher, är det ett stort plus.
 



  





 För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är en nyfiken, engagerad och lösningsorienterad person som brinner för teknik, data och analys. Du gillar att förstå helheten, men har samtidigt öga för detaljerna som gör skillnad. Du arbetar strukturerat, noggrant och med kvalitet i fokus, samtidigt som du är en lagspelare som trivs i samarbete med andra. Du är kommunikativ, lyhörd och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap för att bidra till en stark datakultur och gemensam utveckling.
 



 Du har god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska. Företagsspråket är engelska, vilket innebär att dokumentation och presentationer sker på engelska.
 



  





**Om BROCC** 




 Hos BROCC får du inte bara en spännande roll, du får också möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad. Vi är ett innovativt fintechbolag som kombinerar teknik, data och affär för att skapa rättvisa och värdeskapande finansiella tjänster. Sedan starten 2016 har vi utmanat branschen med vår vision om att bygga en modern, transparent och kundcentrerad finansiell plattform. Genom förvärv av GCC Capital AB (nu Brocc Finance AB) och Chassi Group med bolagen HandlarFinans och AMCAP, har vi växt till en stark koncern med ett brett erbjudande inom in- och utlåning, försäkring och objektfinansiering i Sverige och Finland.
 



  





 Vi står under Finansinspektionens tillsyn, och våra bolag omfattas av den statliga insättningsgarantin, något som ger våra kunder trygghet och våra medarbetare en stabil grund att bygga vidare på. Hos oss får du arbeta i en modern och tekniskt avancerad miljö, där innovation och affärsutveckling går hand i hand. Vi sitter i fina lokaler mitt i centrala Stockholm. Låter det intressant? Läs gärna mer på www.brocc.se
 



  





**Ansök enkelt med ditt CV** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Inhouse IT & Tech. Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst på heltid med placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Vi tar inte emot några ansökningar via mejl, utan du söker enkelt tjänsten via www.inhouse.se. Ansök redan idag då urval sker löpande!
 



 Har du några funderingar så är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Louise Hagen Furugård, louise.furugard@inhouse.se, 0733118726
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Utvecklare med fokus på molntjänster till Sweco i Stockholm/Uppsala
description:
*Vill du koda något som gör skillnad på riktigt? Vi planerar och utvecklar samhällen så att de blir mer hållbara, bättre och smartare för både oss och kommande generationer. Vi jobbar i uppdrag med allt från rengöring av vatten, energiprojekt i Afrika, till att vi räddar liv genom att förebygga viltolyckor och bevarar biologisk mångfald. Nu söker vi dig som vill fortsätta utveckla framtidens samhällen med oss!* 
  

  

**Vilka är vi?**
 Vi är cirka 300 konsulter med teknisk kompetens och som brinner för innovativa lösningar. Vi är utvecklare, UX are, BIM are, data- och informationssamordnare, geodataexperter, GIS are, FME-experter, informationssäkerhetsspecialister, IT-projektledare och andra tekniska specialister. Tillsammans utgör vi Digital Services, som är en del utav Sweco med ett 50-tal kontor i hela Sverige. Vi har flera interna nätverk där vi delar erfarenheter och kompetens. Varje kontor har sin unika tillhörighet, med frukostar, aktiviteter, AW s och andra roliga saker för att lära känna varandra bättre och för att ha roligt tillsammans! I Stockholm är vårt kontor placerat med vacker utsikt över Kungsholmen och även i Uppsala sitter vi centralt placerat i en fin och härlig kontorsmiljö.
   

  

 Som företag satsar vi på ett ständigt lärande med bra kompetensutveckling och interna utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi är en flexibel arbetsplats som värderar att må bra på jobbet med en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Som företag arbetar vi aktivt med hållbarhet, jämställdhet och mångfald. Det betyder bland annat att vi arbetar enligt FN s hållbarhetsmål, att vi finns med på den gröna listan över jämställda börsbolag och att vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat.
   

  

**Din framtida roll**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kan du i hög grad själv styra dina dagar både avseende arbetstid och fysisk plats. Vi arbetar i stöttande team där vi vill ta vara på just dina kompetenser och styrkor. Vi vill att du ska arbeta kreativt och innovativt med det som intresserar dig och vi arbetar i många olika spännande uppdrag. Vår målsättning är att du själv ska kunna påverka vilka uppdrag du vill arbeta i. Därmed kan du arbeta med många olika tekniker, språk och ramverk. Detta gör du självklart med stöd från kompetenta kollegor där vi lägger stor vikt vid att du får lära dig allt du behöver för tjänsten och för din fortsatta utveckling.
   

  

 Som utvecklare hos oss får du koda komplexa system och lösningar åt våra kunder. I din roll kommer du även att vara högst delaktig i uppsättningen av arkitektur i molnplattformar, varför det är viktigt att du är van att navigera i de olika funktionaliteter och möjligheter som finns. Vi jobbar ofta agilt och arbetar nära våra kunder med högt fokus på konkreta lösningar i linje med deras behov.
   

  

**Den vi söker – är det du?**
 För att passa i denna roll tror vi att du är en problemlösare som är engagerad i ditt arbete och nyfiken på att lära dig nytt. Du kan både arbeta självständigt och i team. Det är viktigt att du är van vid att förklara tekniska lösningar för beslutsfattare på olika nivåer, du är inte främmande för att vara drivande i kommunikationen mellan teknisk lösning och verksamhetsbehov. Vi tror att du tidigare har haft roller som exempelvis teamlead eller teknisk projektledare, alternativt att du informellt tagit dessa roller gentemot beställare. Därför ser vi gärna att du har
   

  

* Relevant utbildning från universitet eller yrkeshögskola
* Minst åtta års erfarenhet av systemutveckling
* Erfarenhet av att hantera komplexa integrationer och uppsättning av molnlösningar
* Utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor i både svenska och engelska
* Djup kunskap i minst ett programmeringsspråk


**Det är meriterande om du har**
* God vana att arbeta mot olika typer av databaser
* Tidigare erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt/IT-arkitekt
* Kunskaper inom andra programmeringsspråk
* Relevant certifiering kopplat till dina kunskaper


**Ansökan**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Alla sökande får återkoppling när rekryteringsprocessen är avslutad.
   

  

**Kontakta oss**
 Vill du höra mer om tjänsten och hur vi jobbar i gruppen? Välkommen att kontakta gruppchef Daniela Sandell på daniela.sandell@sweco.se eller gruppchef Anton Sandström på anton.sandstrom@sweco.se.
   

  

 På Sweco vill vi vara en arbetsplats präglad av mångfald. Vi tror att fler perspektiv breddar vår förmåga att fortsätta nå våra mål och eftersträvar mångfald i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

 Sweco planerar och utformar morgondagens hållbara samhällen och städer. Med den samlade kunskapen hos våra 23 000 arkitekter, ingenjörer och andra experter arbetar vi tillsammans med våra kunder för att möjliggöra den gröna omställningen, maximera digitaliseringens potential och stärka samhällets motståndskraft. Sweco är Europas ledande konsultföretag inom arkitektur och teknik med en omsättning på cirka 31 miljarder SEK under 2024. Företaget är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm. www.swecogroup.com.
